0.21709998.11994285.html.plaintext.txt	189	: 972- 8 934 3597; Fax: 972- 8 934 4118; E-mail: m.
0.21709998.11994285.html.plaintext.txt	190	Published, JBC Papers in Press, May 6, 2002, DOI 10.
0.21709998.11994285.html.plaintext.txt	191	The abbreviations used are: MODY, maturity-onset diabetes of the young; HNF4, hepatocyte nuclear factor 4; DN, dominant negative; HNF1, hepatocyte nuclear factor 1; EMSA, electrophoretic mobility shift assay; RSV, Rous sarcoma virus; CMV, cytomegalovirus; TK, thymidine kinase; LUC, luciferase; HBE, HNF4 binding element.
0.21709998.11994285.html.plaintext.txt	192	Copyright   2002 by The American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Inc.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	0	The Synergistic Effect of Dexamethasone and All-trans-retinoic Acid on Hepatic Phosphoenolpyruvate Carboxykinase Gene Expression Involves the Coactivator p300* Xiaohui L.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Wang, Birger Herzog, Mary Waltner-Law, Robert K.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	2	 Hall, Masakazu Shiota, and Daryl K.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	3	From the Department of Molecular Physiology and Biophysics, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, Tennessee 37232-0615 and Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center, Nashville, Tennessee 37212.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	4	Received for publication, March 29, 2004 , and in revised form, May 25, 2004.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	5	Activation of PEPCK gene transcription by RA occurs through a multicomponent retinoic acid-response unit (RARU) that consists of two separate retinoic acid-response elements, RARE1 and RARE2, each of which binds an RAR/RXR heterodimer (4, 7).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Activation of PEPCK gene transcription by Dex also requires a multicomponent glucocorticoid-response unit (GRU), which consists of two nonconsensus glucocorticoid receptor-binding sites (GR1 and GR2) (8), and four accessory factor-binding sites (gAF1, gAF2, gAF3, and the cAMP-response element (CRE)), which bind COUP-TF/HNF4, HNF3, COUP-TF, and C/EBP, respectively (9 to 12).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	7	 A mutation of any one of the accessory elements results in a 50 to 60% reduction of Dex-induced PEPCK gene transcription in H4IIE hepatoma cells (11).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Any combination of the mutation of two elements nearly abolishes this response (11).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	9	Most interesting, RARE1 and RARE2 in the RARU are coincident with gAF1 and gAF3 in the GRU (4, 7, 9, 13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	10	 The respective transcription factors are present in about the same abundance in the H4IIE cell nucleus, and each binds with approximately the same affinity to these elements.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	11	 Thus, it is of interest to understand how a cell responds to either of these inducers, whether different constellations of accessory factors and coregulators are used for each response and whether there is any functional interaction between the two units in the presence of both ligands.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	12	In this study, we demonstrate that the Dex/RA combination has a synergistic effect on endogenous PEPCK gene expression in both primary hepatocytes and H4IIE hepatoma cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	13	 This response is most dependent on the gAF3 and GR1 elements.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	14	 Upon treatment with Dex/RA, ligand-activated RAR/RXR heterodimers, GR, HNF3, HNF4, p/CIP, SRC-1, CBP, p300, and RNA polymerase II (pol II) are present on the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Notably, the recruitment of p300 and pol II on the PEPCK promoter is increased upon Dex/RA treatment.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	16	 The important role of p300 is illustrated by the fact that its reduction results in a selective loss of the synergistic effect of Dex/RA, whereas a similar reduction of CBP has no effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	17	Cell Culture and Transfection H4IIE hepatoma cells were grown in stationary culture in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM) supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum at 37  degrees C in 5% CO2.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	18	 Transfection was performed using the calcium phosphate precipitation method as described previously (17) using 10  microg of a reporter plasmid (wild type or mutations of PEPCK-LUC).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	19	 The cells were subsequently washed and incubated for 18 h in DMEM containing 500 nM dexamethasone (Dex) and/or 5  microM all-trans-retinoic acid (RA) (Sigma).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	20	 Cells were harvested by trypsin digestion and resuspended in 200  microl of lysis buffer (Promega).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	21	 Firefly luciferase activity was measured and corrected for transfection efficiency with Renilla luciferase activity using the dual-luciferase reporter assay system (Promega).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	22	H4IIE cells are transfected with  < 1% efficiency; therefore, a rat kidney fibroblast cell line, KNRK cells, was employed.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	23	 These cells express abundant amounts of p300 and CBP and are transfected with 80% efficiency, as measured by the expression of enhanced green fluorescent proteins.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	24	 They are therefore very useful in establishing the efficacy and selectivity of candidate siRNA molecules.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	25	 KNRK cells were grown at 37  degrees C in DMEM supplemented with 5% calf serum, nonessential amino acids, and 4.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	26	 These cells were cultured in 6-well plates for 24 h and transfected with LipofectAMINE 2000 (Invitrogen).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	27	 2  microg of the siRNA vectors were transfected into 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	28	5  microg of enhanced green fluorescent proteins were cotransfected as a control for transfection efficiency.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Control cells were transfected with empty pSUPER vector.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	30	 Cells were assayed for p300 or CBP expression 72 h after transfection by using Western blot assays of cell lysates.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	31	 -Actin was used to control for any differences in cell numbers or protein loading.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	32	Real Time PCR Primary hepatocytes were deprived of serum overnight and then were either left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 4 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Total RNA was extracted from these cells, and 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	34	5  microg of this was transcribed using 50 units of Taqman reverse transcriptase (Applied Biosystems) and 125  microM random hexamer primers.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	35	 Real time PCR reactions were performed on one-tenth of the reverse-transcribed RNA using primers specific for the PEPCK and cyclophilin genes.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	36	 A 50- microl master mix of the following reaction components was prepared for each real time PCR: 18  microl of water, 100 nM forward primer, 100 nM reverse primer, 25  microl of 2x SYBR Green PCR master mix (Applied Biosystems), and 5  microl (one-tenth) of the reverse-transcribed RNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	37	 The sequence of the forward PEPCK primer was 5'-GAATCAGCCAGATGTAATCCCG-3', and the sequence of the reverse PEPCK primer was 5'-CATTGTGCTTGCTGGTTTGC-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	38	 The sequence of the forward cyclophilin primer was 5'-AAGGTGAAAGAAGGCATGAGCA-3', and the sequence of the reverse cyclophilin primer was 5'-AGTTGTCCACAGTCGGAGATGG-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	39	 The following real time PCR protocol was used: denaturation and enzyme activation at 95  degrees C for 10 min followed by a two-step amplification and quantification program consisting of 40 cycles of denaturation for 15 s at 95  degrees C and annealing/extension for 1 min at 60  degrees C.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Data were analyzed using the SDS version 1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	41	Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assays (ChIP) H4IIE cells (1 x 108 cells per treatment) were kept in serum-free DMEM at 37  degrees C in 5% CO2 for about 48 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	42	 After a 2-h hormone treatment, protein-DNA cross-linking was performed with 1% formaldehyde in serum-free DMEM at room temperature for 10 min.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	43	 The cells were then harvested into PBS buffer (ice-cold 1x PBS with protease inhibitors: 1 mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride, 1  microg/ml aprotinin, 1  microg/ml leupeptin, 1  microg/ml pepstatin).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	44	 The cells were then pelleted and resuspended in SDS lysis buffer (1% SDS, 10 mM EDTA, 50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8, with protease inhibitors).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	45	 After incubation on ice for 20 min, the lysates were mixed with 25- microm-diameter glass beads (MO-SCI Corp.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	46	5-mm tip) at 4  degrees C 10 times with 15-s pulses at a setting of 6 (output of 6 watts) to shear chromatin to 500-bp fragments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	47	 The supernatant from each sample was divided into aliquots for a subsequent 10-fold dilution in ChIP dilution buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	48	7 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8, with protease inhibitors).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	49	 Each sample was pre-cleared to reduce nonspecific background using 40  microl of a 1:1 protein A/G-agarose slurry (Santa Cruz Biotechnology) supplemented with 100  microg/ml salmon sperm DNA (Stratagene) for 3 h at 4  degrees C on a rotating wheel.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	50	 The beads were then pelleted, and the supernatant was transferred to a new tube.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	51	 The precleared extracts were incubated overnight with 4  microg of the antibody or without antibody (as a negative control) at 4  degrees C on a rotating wheel.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	52	 Immune complexes were collected using 40  microl of a 1:1 protein-A/G-agarose slurry plus 100  microg/ml salmon sperm DNA, with constant rotation for 3 h at 4  degrees C.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	53	 The agarose beads were pelleted at 1000 x g for 2 min and washed for 10 min at room temperature with 1 ml of each of the following buffers in succession: low salt wash buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	54	1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA, 20 mM Tris-HCl, 150 mM NaCl, pH 8), high salt wash buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	55	1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA, pH 8, 20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8, 500 mM NaCl, pH 8), LiCl wash buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	56	25 M LiCl, 1% Nonidet P-40, 1% sodium deoxycholate, 1 mM EDTA, 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8), and 2x with TE buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	57	 Chromatin complexes were eluted from the beads by two 1-h incubations with 160  microl of elution buffer (1% SDS, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	58	1 M NaHCO3) at room temperature.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	59	 The DNA-protein cross-links were reversed by incubating the samples at 65  degrees C for 12 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	60	 The RNA and protein in the samples were digested using an RNase mixture (Ambion) and 50  microg/ml proteinase K, respectively.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	61	 The DNA was purified using the QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen) and resuspended in 50  microl of nuclease-free water.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Five microliter aliquots were used for each PCR or real time PCR utilizing primers specific for PEPCK or -actin promoters.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	63	 The forward primer used for the PEPCK gene promoter was 5'-GTTTCACGTCTCAGAGCTGA-3'; the reverse primer was 5'-ACCGTGACTGTTGCTGATGC-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	64	 The forward and reverse primers used for the -actin gene promoter were described previously (18).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	65	 PCR products were run on a 2% agarose gel and visualized by ethidium bromide staining.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	66	 Real time PCR was performed as described above.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	67	 The antibodies used for GR, RAR, RXR, HNF3, HNF4, PCAF, p300, CBP, SRC-1, and p/CIP were obtained from Santa Cruz Biotechnology (Santa Cruz, CA); anti-RNA polymerase II was from Berkeley Antibody Co.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	68	Small Interfering RNA The mammalian vector pSUPER was used for the expression of siRNAs specifically targeted against rat p300 and CBP mRNAs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	69	 The pSUPER vector consists of an H1-RNA promoter, which directs the synthesis of siRNA transcripts (19).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	70	 The target sequence of the p300 mRNA is a 21-nucleotide sequence corresponding to nucleotide positions 88 to 108 downstream from the transcription start site of this gene, which is separated by a 9-nucleotide noncomplementary spacer sequence followed by the reverse complement of the same 21-nucleotide sequence.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	71	 The cloning of the sequence was facilitated by BamHI and HindIII flanking sites.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	72	 This vector is referred to as p300 siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	73	 The siRNA specific for CBP was made in a similar way by using a 21-nucleotide sequence corresponding to nucleotide positions 122 to 142 downstream of the transcription start site of this gene; the resulting vector is referred to as CBP siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	74	Western Blot Analysis siRNA-treated KNRK cells were washed twice with ice-cold PBS.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	75	 These cells were disrupted in a detergent lysis buffer (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	76	6, 1 mM EDTA, 1 mM EGTA, 1 mM Na3VO4, 20 mM Na4P2O7, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	77	2% Triton X-100, 10 nM microcystin, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	78	1 M phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride, 1  microg/ml aprotinin, 1  microg/ml pepstatin, and 1  microg/ml leupeptin).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	79	 A 40- microg aliquot of protein from each treatment was loaded on a 6% Tris-glycine gel (Invitrogen).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	80	 After electrophoresis, the separated proteins were transferred to a nitrocellulose membrane (Invitrogen).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	81	 The membrane was incubated for 2 h with the appropriate antibody, followed by incubation with an anti-rabbit or anti-mouse IgG conjugated to horseradish peroxidase.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Immunoreactive proteins were detected using the ECL immunodetection system (Amersham Biosciences).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	83	 To assess the specificity of siRNA, the membrane probed with p300 antibody was re-probed with CBP antibody and vice versa.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	84	Statistical Analysis Statistical analyses were performed using Student's t test, with the significance level set at p  <  0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	85	View larger version (20K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	86	 Regulation of PEPCK gene expression by Dex/RA in rat primary hepatocytes and H4IIE hepatoma cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	87	 A, H4IIE cells were serum-deprived overnight, and then were either left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 4 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Total RNA was extracted from these cells, and 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	89	5  microg of RNA was subjected to reverse-transcription.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	90	 Real time PCRs were performed on the reverse-transcribed RNA using primers encoding cDNA sequences for PEPCK and cyclophilin, as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	91	" B, the experiment described in A was performed using isolated rat hepatocytes.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	92	 Data were analyzed using the SDS version 1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	93	 Results represent the means  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	94	 of four to six independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	95	 The horizontal bar in the Dex/RA column in this and other figures indicates the value that would have been achieved if the result was additive.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	96	  RAR/RXR Heterodimers at the gAF3 Element Are Primarily Involved in the Synergistic Effect The involvement of specific cis-elements and their cognate transcription factors in this synergistic effect was defined by using a number of variations of the PEPCK-LUC reporter plasmid, which contains the wild type PEPCK promoter from  to 467 to +69 ligated to the luciferase reporter gene.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	97	 Upon treatment of H4IIE cells with 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or a combination of the two, PEPCK promoter-driven luciferase reporter gene expression is induced 3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	98	 This greater than additive response is qualitatively similar to that noted in expression of the endogenous gene (see Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	99	 1A); hence, this transient transcription approach can be used to define the DNA elements and associated transcription factors involved in this response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	100	View larger version (35K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	101	 The gAF3 element is primarily involved in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Mutations of PEPCK-LUC that replace gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3 with a Gal4 DNA-binding element(s) individually, or gAF1 and gAF3 in combination, were made.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	103	 H4IIE cells were transfected with 10  microg of a reporter plasmid (wild type or mutated forms of PEPCK-LUC) and 100 ng of PRL-SV40 Renilla luciferase vector as a control for transfection efficiency.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	104	 Cells were left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h, and cell lysates were prepared for dual luciferase assays as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	105	" Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	106	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	107	 Results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	108	  Mutations of PEPCK-LUC that replace gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3 with a Gal4 DNA-binding element(s) individually, or gAF1 and gAF3 in combination, were made to identify the involvement of these accessory elements in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Results consistent with previously published data from our laboratory show that any single mutation of these three gAFs reduces the Dex-induced response by about 50%, and the mutation of both gAF1 and gAF3 abolishes the response (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	110	 By contrast, the major effect of RA is facilitated through gAF3, although a small effect is mediated through gAF1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	111	 gAF2 is not involved in the RA effect, as noted earlier (13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	112	 Correspondingly, gAF2 has no qualitative effect on the synergistic response (the total effect is reduced because of the decreased response to Dex), whereas both gAF1, and especially gAF3, have major effects (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	113	The gAF1 element was converted to a consensus binding element for either HNF4 or COUP-TF which do not bind RXR (9).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	114	 In accordance with a previous observation, the presence of consensus HNF4- or COUP-TF-binding elements at gAF1 decreases the RA-induced response by about 50% (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	115	 A significant synergistic effect of Dex/RA was not achieved from these constructs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	116	 However, the presence of a consensus RAR/RXR-binding element (cRARE) at gAF1, which excludes HNF4 or COUP-TF binding, promotes a significant increase of the RA response but reduces the Dex response by about 50% (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	117	 Nonetheless, the synergistic effect is fully supported when gAF1 is replaced by a cRARE (gAF1-cRARE PEPCK-LUC).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	118	View larger version (34K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	119	 cRARE at gAF1 restores the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	120	 H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of wild type PEPCK-LUC or mutated forms of PEPCK-LUC in which the gAF1 element was replaced with a consensus binding element for either an HNF4, COUP-TF homodimer, or RAR/RXR heterodimers.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	121	 Cells were left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Dual luciferase assays were performed as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	123	" The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	124	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	125	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	126	  The gAF3 element includes two RAR/RXR sites, and , separated by a 5-bp linker sequence (see Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	127	 An E box, which binds the transcription factor USF, is located immediately downstream (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	128	 The and elements, and the E box, were mutated in the context of PEPCK-LUC to determine which component of gAF3 is involved in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	129	 As expected from previous studies (11), the E box mutation does not affect either of the Dex or RA responses nor does it have an effect on the Dex/RA response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	130	 A mutation of the site slightly reduces the RA-induced response but has no significant effect on the Dex-induced response or on the Dex/RA-induced synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	131	 By contrast, a mutation of the site of gAF3 significantly reduces both the RA and Dex effects and abolishes the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	132	 These data indicate that transcription factors binding to the site of gAF3 mediate the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	133	View larger version (33K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	134	 The element in gAF3 is important for the synergistic effect of Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	135	 The components of gAF3 are illustrated in the top panel.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	136	 Transfection experiments were performed, as described in Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	137	 2, in H4IIE cells by using variations of PEPCK-LUC in which the , elements of gAF3, and the E box, were individually mutated.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	138	 The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	139	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	140	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	141	  The approach employed in the experiment described in Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	142	 3 was used to infer the binding of transcription factors to the gAF3 element upon Dex/RA treatment (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	143	 The full synergistic effect was supported only when gAF3 was converted to a cRARE (gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	144	 The cRARE binds RAR/RXR heterodimers with a higher affinity than either HNF4 or COUP-TF (16), thus the RA response in a construct in which gAF3 was changed to a consensus RAR/RXR-binding element is greater than that obtained from the wild type PEPCK-LUC (12-fold versus 3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	145	 The response of constructs in which both gAF1 and gAF3 were converted to cRAREs (gAF1/gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC) was similar to that of gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	146	 This implies that gAF3 is more important than gAF1 in promoting the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression and that ligand-bound RAR/RXR heterodimers play a critical role.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	147	View larger version (31K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	148	 cRARE at gAF3 restores the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	149	 H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of PEPCK-LUC or mutated forms of PEPCK-LUC in which the gAF3 element was replaced with a consensus binding element for RAR/RXR heterodimers or a Gal4 DNA-binding element.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	150	 Cells were left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Dual luciferase assays were performed as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	152	" The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Data are presented as the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	154	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	155	  The GR1 Glucocorticoid Receptor-binding Site Is Involved in the Synergistic Effect Block mutations of GR1 and/or GR2, which prevent the binding of GR, were made in the context of the PEPCK-LUC construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	156	 6) reduces Dex-induced PEPCK gene expression by 60%, whereas mGR2 has little effect, as expected (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	157	 The synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression is totally abolished in mGR1 but is not affected by mGR2 (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	158	 These results indicate that GR1, but not GR2, is involved in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression, which is consistent with our previous report (8) that GR1 is more important for Dex-induced PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	159	View larger version (37K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	160	 GR1 is involved in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	161	 PEPCK-LUC constructs were made that contain a mutated GR1 (mGR1), a mutated GR2 (mGR2), a combined mutation of GR1 and GR2 (mGR1/2), or a palindromic GR-binding element (pal GR1).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	162	 H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of PEPCK-LUC or mutant forms of PEPCK-LUC.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	163	 The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	165	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	166	  GR1 is a weak, nonconsensus GR-binding site which, by itself, cannot induce a Dex response on PEPCK gene expression (8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	167	 The accessory factor elements gAF1 to gAF3, with associated transcription factors, increase the affinity of binding of liganded GR to GR1/GR2 and stabilize this binding (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	168	 The gAF1 and gAF3 accessory elements are not necessary when GR1/GR2 are replaced with high affinity, palindromic GR-binding elements (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	169	 To test whether ligand-activated RAR/RXR heterodimers are necessary in the presence of a high affinity GR-binding element, GR1 was converted to a palindromic glucocorticoid-response element (palGRE) in the context of PEPCK-LUC.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	170	 PEPCK luciferase activity is induced 80-fold by Dex in the context of palGR1 PEPCK-LUC, but when both Dex and RA are present, PEPCK gene expression is not further augmented (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Most interesting, the synergistic effect of Dex/RA is not seen when GR1 is converted to a palindromic high affinity GR-binding site, which is independent of gAF1 and gAF3 (8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	172	 By contrast, when either gAF1 or gAF3 is converted to a consensus RAR/RXR-binding element, in the context of the wild type GR1/GR2 elements, the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression is actually augmented (see Figs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	173	 Taken together, we conclude that the synergistic effect of Dex/RA involves enhanced GR binding to the nonconsensus GR1 element and that this may be facilitated by the binding of RAR/RXR heterodimers.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	174	Dex/RA Treatment Affects the Binding of Transcription Factors to the PEPCK Gene Promoter in Vivo ChIPs were performed in untreated and hormone-treated H4IIE cells to identify the in vivo binding profile of accessory factors, nuclear receptors, and coregulators to the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	175	 GR is only recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter when Dex is present (1- versus 13.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	176	0-fold), as shown previously (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	177	 This association is increased by the combined Dex/RA treatment (13.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	178	 7, Table I), which is consistent with the functional data illustrated above.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	179	 This leads us to hypothesize that RAR/RXR heterodimers enhance GR binding/function.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	180	View larger version (28K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	181	 GR, RAR/RXR, HNF3, and HNF4 are present on the PEPCK gene promoter upon treatment with Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	182	 A, the association of GR, RAR, RXR, HNF3, and HNF4 with the endogenous PEPCK gene promoter was measured by ChIP in H4IIE cells treated for 2 h under the following conditions: no hormone, 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or 500 nM Dex/5  microM RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	183	 No Ab lanes show the results of immunoprecipitations performed in parallel without the application of primary antibodies.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	184	 Input lanes show the results from samples not subjected to immunoprecipitation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	185	 B, the association of GR, RAR, RXR, HNF3, and HNF4 with the endogenous -actin gene promoter was measured by ChIP, as a negative control.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	186	 Results are representative of four to six independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	187	View this table:    TABLE I The occupancy of the PEPCK gene promoter by transcription factors and coregulators changes upon treatment with Dex and/or RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	188	The numbers shown are derived from quantitative real time PCR analysis of PEPCK promoter fragments co-immunoprecipitated with the indicated antibody after ChIP.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	189	 The data are expressed as the fold difference relative to the control (untreated) samples from four to six independent assays.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	190	  In some genes RA is thought to bind to DNA-bound RAR/RXR heterodimers, and the RA-RAR interaction results in the release of a corepressor complex and the subsequent association of a coactivator complex (22, 23).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	191	 There is a significant association of RAR and RXR to the PEPCK gene promoter in the absence of ligand, but there is a substantial increase of binding of both (2-fold increase) when RA is added to the cells (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	192	 This association is not increased by the concomitant administration of Dex.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	193	HNF3 binds to the PEPCK gene promoter constitutively, presumably to gAF2 (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	194	 7) (10, 18), which is consistent with functional data in which we have shown that this element is not involved in either the RA or Dex/RA-induced synergistic responses on PEPCK gene expression (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	195	 HNF4 is also bound to the PEPCK gene promoter in untreated cells and in cells treated with Dex and/or RA (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	196	SRC-1 and p/CIP, members of the p160 nuclear receptor family, are recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter upon treatment with Dex and/or RA (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	197	 Although Dex causes a somewhat greater recruitment of SRC-1 and p/CIP to the PEPCK gene promoter than RA (3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	198	8- versus 2-fold, respectively, Table I), the recruitment of these proteins is not further increased when both ligands are present.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	199	 PCAF, a HAT family protein, is present in H4IIE cells but is not located on the PEPCK gene promoter under any of these treatment conditions.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	200	 This is probably not due to epitope masking, as antibodies specific for different epitopes of PCAF were used.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	201	 CBP and p300 are both recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter upon Dex and/or RA treatment but, despite their structural homology, the binding of CBP and p300 differs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	202	 The recruitment of CBP is induced 3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	203	9-fold upon treatment with Dex or RA, respectively (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	204	 The recruitment of CBP is not further increased (6.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	205	5-fold) by combined treatment with Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	206	 By contrast, recruitment of p300 is increased 4.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	207	7-fold upon treatment with Dex/RA combination as compared with an 2.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	208	0-fold increase upon treatment with either RA or Dex alone, respectively.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Antibodies specific for different epitopes of CBP and p300 were also used in this experiment, and similar recruitment profiles of CBP and p300 were observed in each case (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	210	 The increased recruitment of RNA pol II (2-, 2-, and 5-fold upon treatment with RA, Dex, and RA/Dex, respectively) parallels the change in p300 binding (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	211	 Similar changes in the binding patterns of these nuclear proteins were noted in primary hepatocytes (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	212	View larger version (32K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	213	 Recruitment of p300 to the PEPCK gene promoter is increased upon treatment with Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	214	 A, the association of PCAF, SRC-1, p/CIP, CBP, p300, and pol II with the endogenous PEPCK gene promoter was measured by ChIP in H4IIE cells treated for 2 h under the following conditions: no hormone, 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or 500 nM Dex/5  microM RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	215	 No Ab lanes show the results of immunoprecipitations performed in parallel without the application of primary antibodies.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	216	 Input lanes show the results from samples not subjected to immunoprecipitation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	217	 B, the association of the above proteins with the endogenous -actin gene promoter was measured by ChIP, as a negative control.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Results are representative of four to six independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	219	  p300 Is Specifically Involved in the Synergistic Effect The difference in association of p300 and CBP when H4IIE cells are exposed to Dex/RA is interesting in view of the observation that these proteins interact with many transcription factors and nuclear receptors in the regulation of gene transcription and are often considered to be interchangeable.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	220	 Selective reduction of p300 or CBP was used to establish the role of these proteins in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	221	 siRNAs directed against p300 or CBP mRNA were cloned into the pSUPER mammalian expression vector (designated as p300 siRNA and CBP siRNA, respectively).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	222	 A Western blot analysis, performed using cell lysates prepared 72 h after transfection of these siRNAs into KNRK cells, shows that the siRNA directed against either p300 or CBP mRNA inhibited the endogenous expression of each of these proteins (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	223	 To validate the specificity of the siRNAs, the nitrocellulose membrane used in the p300 analysis was re-blotted with the CBP antibody and vice versa.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	224	 The p300 siRNA does not affect CBP gene expression, nor does the CBP siRNA affect p300 gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	225	 -Actin expression is not affected by either treatment.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	226	 Thus, the siRNAs cause a major and selective reduction of the cognate proteins.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	227	View larger version (26K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	228	 Selective reduction of p300, but not CBP, results in a loss of the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	229	 A, 2  microg of either the siRNA vector targeted against p300 or the empty pSUPER vector (control) was transiently transfected into rat KNRK cells (see "Materials and Methods").
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	230	 Cells were assayed for p300 expression 72 h after transfection using Western blot analysis of cell lysates.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	231	 The nitrocellulose membrane used in the p300 analysis was re-blotted with the CBP antibody to assess the specificity of the siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	232	 -Actin was used to control for protein loading.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	233	 The data shown are representative of four separate experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	234	 B, a transfection experiment was performed as described in A using an siRNA vector targeted against CBP.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	235	 The nitrocellulose membrane used in the CBP analysis was re-blotted with the p300 antibody to assess the specificity of the siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	236	 C, H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of PEPCK-LUC, 100 ng of PRL-SV40, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	237	5  microg of RSV-GR, CMX-RAR, and CMX-RXR expression vectors with 15  microg of either pSUPER alone (control), p300 siRNA, or CBP siRNA for 72 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Cells were then left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h before they were harvested.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	239	 Dual luciferase assays were performed as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	240	" Results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of PEPCK-LUC.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	242	 of four independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	243	  H4IIE cells were transfected with PEPCK-LUC, RSV-GR, CMX-RAR, and CMX-RXR expression vectors with either pSUPER alone (control), p300 siRNA, or CBP siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	244	 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or a combination of the two, was added to the cells 18 h before harvest.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	245	 By using PEPCK-LUC reporter gene expression with Dex/RA treatment as 100%, the induction by RA or Dex is 10 and 65%, respectively (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	246	 This is quantitatively similar to the pattern of endogenous PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	247	 The Dex-induced response was reduced to 35% of the maximal response in p300 siRNA-transfected H4IIE cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	248	 By contrast, the RA-induced response was not changed.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	249	 The Dex/RA-induced response is, however, reduced to 37%, which is similar to the reduction of the Dex-induced response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	250	 This result indicates that the synergy achieved with Dex/RA is abolished when p300 expression is reduced.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	251	 The Dex-induced response was also reduced to 29% in CBP siRNA-transfected H4IIE cells, and the RA-induced response was not affected.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	252	 The Dex/RA-induced response was only reduced to 53%, which is mainly because of the decreased response to Dex; however, the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression still remained (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	253	 These results indicate that p300, but not CBP, is involved in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	254	The Dex response was reduced by 50 to 60% in the experiment in which a cRARE was substituted for gAF3, which normally binds COUP-TF as an accessory factor in the Dex response (11, 13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	255	 Thus, unliganded RAR/RXR, if bound to the cRARE, cannot serve as an accessory factor for the Dex response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	256	 However, when RA is added, a robust synergistic effect is obtained, as noted above (and Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Although indirect, this suggests that ligand-bound RAR/RXR can serve as an accessory factor in the Dex response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	258	The role of the accessory factors at gAF1, gAF2, and gAF3 (HNF4/COUP-TF, HNF3, and COUP-TF, respectively) is to increase the affinity of binding of GR to the GR1 element (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Thus, when GR1 is converted to a high affinity site, gAF1 and gAF3 have no additional effect on GR binding (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	260	 Likewise, when GR1 is converted to a palindromic GRE, PEPCK gene expression is at the maximal rate, and there is no additional or synergistic effect of RA (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	261	It is reasonable to presume that Dex and RA each induce the formation of unique transcription complexes and that the combination of Dex/RA results in yet another complex.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	262	 We began an exploration of this topic by using the ChIP assay.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	263	 As noted previously (18), GR is absent from the PEPCK gene promoter in the absence of ligand.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	264	 The addition of Dex results in a 13-fold increase in GR occupancy on the promoter (Table I).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	265	 Small amounts of RAR and RXR appear on the promoter in the absence of ligand; a 2 to 2.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	266	5-fold increase in the binding of both occurs after the addition of RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	267	 Interestingly, the Dex/RA combination has no effect on RAR and RXR occupancy, but GR binding increases from 13- to 21-fold.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	268	 This is in concert with the observation that RAR/RXR acts as an accessory factor to increase the affinity of GR binding and to enhance transcription (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	269	 The occupancy of the accessory factors HNF4 and HNF3 is not affected by any treatment, as noted previously (18).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	270	The promoter occupancy of PCAF, SRC-1, p/CIP, p300, and CBP was analyzed under the various hormone treatments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	271	 There was no binding of PCAF under any of the treatment conditions (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	272	 This was somewhat surprising in view of the observations that RA-activated RAR/RXR heterodimers recruit PCAF to DNA segments that contain the typical DR5 RARE in vitro (26).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	273	 RA and Dex each recruit p/CIP and SRC-1; however, there is no additional binding when the Dex/RA combination is employed.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	274	 Indeed, the binding of these p160 family members is the same in Dex/RA as in Dex-only treated cells (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	275	 A different pattern was noted with CBP.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	276	 RA treatment resulted in more recruitment of CBP than did Dex treatment, and the Dex/RA level was equivalent to that of RA alone.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	277	 The most interesting observation concerns the binding of p300 to the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	278	 RA and Dex each increase the binding of p300 by 2-fold; however, the combination results in about a 5-fold increase (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	279	 A similar quantitative change occurs with the binding of pol II to the promoter (Table I).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	280	 In concert with this observation, McGrane and co-workers (27) recently showed that pol II association with the PEPCK gene promoter is reduced in vitamin A-deficient mice.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	281	A key role for p300 in the synergistic action of Dex/RA was established by selectively reducing the cellular levels of p300 and CBP by siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	282	 Elimination of either had no effect on the RA response, whereas both reduced the Dex effect by about 50%.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	283	 The absence of CBP had no effect on the synergistic effect of the Dex/RA combination, but removal of p300 abolished the response (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	284	 CBP and p300 are closely related proteins.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	285	 Although encoded by different genes, they have several functional domains in common.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	286	 The designation CBP/p300 implies a common overall function; however, recent reports (28) suggest each may govern unique cellular events.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	287	 Mice with inactivation of a single allele of CBP develop a variety of hematological abnormalities that were not seen in mice that had a similar inactivating mutation in one of the p300 alleles.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	288	 By contrast, the selective reduction of p300 makes F9 cells resistant to RA-induced differentiation, whereas a similar reduction of CBP has no effect (29).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	289	The linear increase of the recruitment of p300 and pol II in conjunction with a nonlinear increase of the transcription response is not unexpected.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	290	 Veitia (30) has explained this in the context of a series of cooperative interactions between promoter elements/enhancers and transcription factors with a succession of coregulator proteins and ultimately the basal transcription apparatus.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	291	 The activation of the interferon- gene in response to viral infection is a case in point.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	292	 The synergistic transcription response of this gene is thought to be the result of the formation of a unique activating surface composed of a domain in the p65 subunit of NFB and the activation domains of IRF1 and ATF-2/c-Jun with the architectural protein HMGI(Y).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	293	 This enhanceosome recruits CBP/p300 to the basal transcription complex (31).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	294	 The likely participation of other components unique to the complex assembled on the PEPCK gene promoter in response to Dex/RA awaits further investigation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	295	In addition to the PEPCK gene, a number of other genes that encode enzymes involved in metabolic processes have promoters that allow for a range of gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Examples include the tyrosine aminotransferase, fatty-acid synthase, L-type pyruvate kinase, insulin-like growth factor-binding proteins, and the glucose 6-phosphate catalytic subunit genes (32 to 37).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	297	 We have used the phrase "metabolic control domain" (MCD) to describe an array of DNA elements and associated transcription factors that provide an integrated response to a variety of signals (2, 15).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	298	 As the PEPCK gene MCD is elucidated, the central importance of one element, gAF3, has become apparent.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	299	 4) is involved as an accessory factor in the glucocorticoid response (8), as an important element in the retinoic acid response (7), the thyroid hormone response (5), as a component of the cyclic AMP response unit (15), in the amplifying effect of PGC-1 (38), and now in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA (Figs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	300	 The proteins known to bind to gAF3 include COUP-TF and RAR/RXR.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	301	 It remains to be seen whether these proteins account for all of the roles played by this interesting element in the MCD.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	302	Insulin and glucose, by inhibiting basal and hormone-induced transcription (3, 6, 25), set the lower end of expression of the PEPCK gene.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	303	 The synergistic effect of Dex/RA sets the upper end and expands the repertoire of responses available from this MCD.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	304	 In this regard, it is interesting that RA affords no additional response in the presence of a high affinity GR-binding element (cGRE, Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	305	 6), which elicits an exaggerated response from this otherwise wild type promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	306	 When considered in the context of the MCD, the PEPCK gene promoter may have evolved to have a weak GRE (GR1) which, when combined with the variety of other elements and cognate transcription factors described above, allows for a graduated response between off and fully on and therefore a very flexible means of adjusting the rate of gluconeogenesis.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	307	   FOOTNOTES   * This work was supported by National Institutes of Health Grants DK35107 and DK20593 from the Vanderbilt Diabetes Research and Training Center and by a Mentor-based fellowship award from the American Diabetes Association (to B.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	308	 The costs of publication of this article were defrayed in part by the payment of page charges.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	309	 This article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	310	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	311	To whom correspondence should be addressed: Dept.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	312	 of Molecular Physiology and Biophysics, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, TN 37232-0615.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	313	: 615-322-7004; Fax: 615-322-7236.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	314	1 The abbreviations used are: PEPCK, phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase; RA, all-trans-retinoic acid; Dex, dexamethasone; GR, glucocorticoid receptor; CBP, CREB-binding protein; CREB, cAMP-response element-binding protein; ChIP, chromatin immunoprecipitation assays; RAR, retinoic acid receptors; RARE, retinoic acid-response element; RARU, retinoic acid-response unit; cRARE, consensus RARE; RXR, retinoid X receptor; siRNA, small interfering RNA; DMEM, Dul-becco's modified Eagle's medium; MCD, metabolic control domain; pol, polymerase.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	315	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   We thank Deborah Brown for help in preparation of the manuscript and Sam Wells of the Vanderbilt cell imaging core.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	316	 Evans for providing the CMX-RAR/CMX-RXR plasmids and Richard O'Brien for providing the pSUPER plasmid.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	0	Hepatocyte Nuclear Factor 4 Is a Central Regulator of Bile Acid Conjugation* Yusuke Inoue, Ai-Ming Yu, Junko Inoue, and Frank J.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	1	From the Laboratory of Metabolism, Center for Cancer Research, NCI, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, Maryland 20892.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	2	Received for publication, October 7, 2003 , and in revised form, October 24, 2003.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	3	Hepatocyte nuclear factor 4 (HNF4) is an orphan member of the nuclear receptor hormone superfamily that is mainly expressed in liver, intestine, kidney, and pancreas and regulates expression of target genes including several serum proteins such as apolipoproteins, blood coagulation factors, P450s, and enzymes involved in glucose, lipid, ammonia, steroid, and fatty acid metabolism by binding to direct repeat-1 elements in their promoter or enhancer regions (8, 9).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	4	 Indeed, the expression of hepatic apolipoproteins, including A-II, A-IV, C-II, and C-III, ornithine transcarbamylase involved in ureagenesis, and CYP3A associated with xenobiotic metabolism, was significantly reduced in livers of liver-specific HNF4-null mice (10 to 12).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	5	 A second line of liver-specific HNF4-null mice was established where Cre recombinase was placed under the control of the albumin promoter and the -fetoprotein enhancer (13).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	6	 These mice exhibited a marked reduction in the expression of hepatic glycogen synthase, phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase, and glucose-6-phosphatase, involved in gluconeogenesis, and reduced levels of E-cadherin, ZO-1, and CEACAM1 proteins that are critical for normal liver morphology (13).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	7	Liver-specific HNF4-null mice in the adult exhibited increased serum BAs, and expression of the BA transporters, NTCP and OATP1, was also reduced in these mice (10).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Whereas BA biosynthesis and transport are controlled to some degree by HNF4, it remains unknown whether HNF4 regulates the BA conjugation pathway.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Nuclear receptors are involved in the control of the BA biosynthesis and transport system (6, 14, 15), but the mechanism regulating BA conjugation pathways have not been analyzed.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	10	 BA conjugation reactions are catalyzed by two liver-enriched enzymes, bile acid-CoA ligase (BAL) and bile acid-CoA:amino acid N-acyltransferase (BAT) (1, 14).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	11	 BAL activities are associated with rat BAL protein (16) and human very long chain acyl-CoA synthase homolog 2 (VLACSR-H2) protein (17), but enzymatic analysis of BAL protein has not been performed in the mouse.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Because the mouse very long chain acyl-CoA synthase-related (VLACSR) gene, which is highly expressed only in liver (18) as well as rat BAL and human VLACSR-H2 genes, has a high homology to these proteins (16), it was reasonable to assume that the VLACSR gene might be the mouse homolog for the BAL gene.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	13	 On the other hand, BAT genes have been cloned from mouse (19), rat (20), and human (21).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	14	 The human BAT protein has conjugation activity with both taurine and glycine as substrates (21), but the mouse BAT protein only uses taurine as a substrate (19).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	15	In the present study, the biological function of HNF4 was investigated in vivo and in vitro using liver-specific HNF4-null mice.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	16	 These mice exhibit increased unconjugated and glycine-conjugated BAs in gallbladder bile and decreased expression of VLACSR and BAT.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	17	 Expression of the VLACSR and BAT was shown to be regulated directly by HNF4 via HNF4-binding sites in their promoter regions.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	18	 These results indicate that HNF4 has an important role in the maintenance of BA homeostasis by regulating BA conjugation pathways.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	19	Northern Blot Analysis Total liver RNA (10  microg), extracted with Trizol reagent (Invitrogen), was fractionated by electrophoresis through a formaldehyde-agarose gel and transferred to GeneScreen Plus membranes (DuPont).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	20	 Blots were hybridized at 68  degrees C in PerfectHyb plus solution (Sigma) with random primer-labeled cDNA probes and exposed to a PhosphorImager screen cassette followed by visualization using a Storm 860 PhosphorImager system (Amersham Biosciences).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	21	 All probes were amplified from a mouse cDNA library using gene-specific primers and cloned into the pCR II vector (Invitrogen).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Sequences were verified using CEQ 2000 Dye Terminator cycle sequencing kits (Beckman Coulter, Fullerton, CA) and a CEQ 2000XL DNA Analysis System (Beckman Coulter).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	23	Extraction of Bile Acids from Bile Three  microl of bile or a 1/100 dilution (in methanol) was added into 200  microl of acetonitrile containing 20  microl of 50  microM dehydrocholic acid.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	24	 The sample was vortexed for 10 s and then subsequently centrifuged at 14,000 x g at 4  degrees C for 5 min.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	25	 The supernatant was transferred to a new glass tube and extracted with 2 ml of a mixture of ethyl acetate and t-butyl methyl ether (2/1, v/v).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	26	 After centrifugation at 3,000 x g at 4  degrees C for 15 min, the organic phase was evaporated under a stream of nitrogen gas.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	27	 The residue was reconstituted in 60  microl of a 50% methanol solution containing 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Ten  microl of each reconstituted sample was injected for liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry/mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	29	Identification and Quantitation of Intact Free and Conjugated Bile Acids by LC-MS/MS LC-MS/MS analysis was performed on a PE SCIEX API2000 ESI triple-quadrupole mass spectrometer (PerkinElmer Life Sciences) controlled by Analyst software.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	30	 A Phenomenex Luna C18 3- microm 100 x 2 mm inner diameter column (Torrance, CA) was used to separate free bile acids.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	31	 The flow rate through the column at ambient temperature was 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	32	2 ml/min, and optimal resolution was achieved by elution with a linear gradient of water containing 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	33	1% formic acid (45 0%) and methanol (55 100%) for 10 min at room temperature.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Separation of glycine- and taurine-conjugated bile acids was performed on an Aquasil C18 5- microm 50 x 2 mm inner diameter column (Keystone Scientific Operations, Bellefonte, PA), and the high pressure liquid chromatography system was operated isocratically at a flow rate of 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	35	2 ml/min with the mobile phase (acetonitrile/water/methanol = 30/45/25, v/v/v) containing 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	36	 The mass spectrometer was operated in the turbo ion spray mode with positive ion detection.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	37	 The turbo ion spray temperature was maintained at 350  degrees C, and a voltage of 4.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	38	8 kV was applied to the sprayer needle.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	39	 Nitrogen was used as the turbo ion spray and nebulizing gas.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	40	 The detection and quantification of free and conjugated bile acids and the internal standard were accomplished by multiple reactions monitoring with the transitions m/z 403.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	41	2 for deoxycholic acid, chenodeoxycholic acid, hyodeoxycholic acid, ursodeoxycholic acid, and murideoxycholic acid; 373.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	42	3 for cholic acid, hyocholic acid, - and -muricholic acid (MCA); 391.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	43	4 for glycodeoxycholic acid (GDCA) and glycochenodeoxycholic acid (GCDCA), 516.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	44	4 for taurocholic acid (TCA) and tauro--muricholic acid (T--MCA); and 500.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	45	4 for taurodeoxycholic acid (TDCA) and taurochenodeoxycholic (TCDCA).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	46	 All raw data were processed using Analyst software.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	47	 Calibration curves were linear for free deoxycholic acid, chenodeoxycholic acid, hyodeoxycholic acid, ursodeoxycholic acid, and murideoxycholic acid concentrations ranging from 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	48	05 to 10  microM; free cholic acid, hyocholic acid -, -, and -MCA from 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	49	2 to 20  microM, GDCA and GCDCA from 0.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	50	1 to 10  microM; TDCA and TCDCA from 1.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	51	0 to 200  microM; and glycocholic acid, TCA, and T--MCA from 2.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	52	Determination of the Transcription Start Sites of the Mouse VLACSR and BAT Genes 5'-Rapid amplification of cDNA ends was performed to determine the transcription start site of the mouse VLACSR and BAT genes using GeneRacer kit (Invitrogen).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	53	 PCR products were cloned into pCR TOPO II, and 20 individual clones were sequenced.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	54	 Based on these results, the major transcription start site was determined.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	55	Construction of the Mouse VLACSR and BAT-Luciferase Reporter Plasmids The mouse VLACSR ( to 2219,  to 1435,  to 1014,  to 256,  to 220,  to 194, and  to 146/ to 47 bp from translation start site) and BAT ( to 1972,  to 1567,  to 1447,  to 1322,  to 602,  to 505,  to 136, and  to 52/+178 bp from transcription start site) promoters were amplified by PCR using sequence data derived from the Celera data base (Celera Genomics, Rockville, MD) and cloned into KpnI and XhoI sites of the pGL3/basic vector (Promega, Madison, WI).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	56	 Mutations were introduced into the putative HNF4-binding site in the VLACSR-luciferase constructs by PCR-based site-directed mutagenesis using the following primer pair: 5'-acaaaCTGACAGAGTCCAtgggt-3' and 5'-acccaTGGACTCTGTCAGtttgt-3' (M2; mutations in the HNF4-binding site are boldface and underlined).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	57	 Similarly, mutations were introduced into an Sp1-binding site in the VLACSR-luciferase constructs by PCR-based site-directed mutagenesis using the following primer pair: 5'-tgtccaagTAAAGAAGTGag-3' and 5'-ctCACTTCTTTActtggaca-3' (mutations in the GC box are boldface and underlined).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	58	 Similarly, mutations were introduced into an HNF4-binding site in the BAT-luciferase constructs by PCR-based site-directed mutagenesis using the following primer pair: 5'-agtccaCTTTCCAAGGTCTtagtct-3' and 5'-agactaAGACCTTGGAAAGtggact-3' (mutations in the HNF4-binding site are boldface and underlined).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Sequences were verified using a CEQ 2000XL DNA Analysis System (Beckman Coulter).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	60	Transient Transfection Assay HepG2 and CV-1 cell lines were cultured at 37  degrees C in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (Invitrogen) containing 10% fetal bovine serum (HyClone, Logan, UT) and 100 units/ml penicillin/streptomycin (Invitrogen).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Cells were seeded in 24-well tissue culture plates and grown to 90 to 95% confluency.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	62	 For transfections, 500 ng/well pGL3 basic or the wild-type or mutated BAL and BAT promoters and 200 ng/well pRL/TK (Promega) were used with the total amount of DNA adjusted to 900 ng by the addition of pUC19 as a carrier DNA.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	63	 For cotransfections, 200 ng/well of the rat HNF4 expression plasmid, pSG5/HNF4, was used.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	64	 All transfections were performed using LipofectAMINE 2000 reagent (Invitrogen) according to the manufacturer's instructions.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	65	 After 48 h, the cells were washed with phosphate-buffered saline and assayed for dual luciferase activity using commercial kits (Promega).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	66	Gel Shift Analysis Crude nuclear extracts were prepared, and gel shift analysis was carried out as described previously (11).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	67	 The following three double-stranded probes were used: HNF4-binding site for the mouse VLACSR promoter (wild-type), 5'-acaaaAGGACAGAGTCCAtgggt-3' and 5'-acccaTGGACTCTGTCCTtttgt-3', the mouse VLACSR promoter (mutant), 5'-acaaaCTGACAGAGTCCAtgggt-3' and 5'-acccaTGGACTCTGTCAGtttgt-3' (mutations in the HNF4-binding site are boldface and underlined); GC box for the mouse VLACSR promoter (wild-type), 5'-tgtccaagGGGGCGGGGCag-3' and 5'-ctGCCCCGCCCCcttggacaC-3', HNF4-binding site for the mouse VLACSR promoter (mutant), 5'-tgtccaagTAAAGAAGTGag-3' and 5'-ctCACTTCTTTActtggaca-3' (mutations in the GC box are boldface and underlined); the mouse BAT promoter (wild-type), 5'-agtccaAGTTCCAAGGTCTtagtct-3' and 5'-agactaAGACCTTGGAACTtggact-3', and the mouse BAT promoter (mutant), 5'-agtccaCTTTCCAAGGTCTtagtct-3' and 5'-agactaAGACCTTGGAAAGtggact-3' (mutations in the HNF4-binding site are boldface and underlined).
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	68	 End-labeled double-stranded oligonucleotide (2 x 105 cpm) was added, and the reaction mixture was incubated at room temperature for 30 min.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	69	 For competition experiments, a 25-fold excess of unlabeled oligonucleotide was added to the reaction mixture, and the mixture was incubated at room temperature for 20 min prior to the addition of a 32P-labeled oligonucleotide probe.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	70	 For supershift analysis, 1  microg of anti-HNF4 antibody (Santa Cruz Biotechnology) was added to the reaction mixture, and the mixture was incubated at room temperature for 30 min after the addition of a 32P-labeled oligonucleotide probe.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	71	Statistical Analysis All values are expressed as the means  plus or minus  S.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	72	 3, 4, 6, and 7) or standard deviation (S.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	73	 All data were analyzed by the unpaired Student's t test for significant differences between the mean values of each group.
0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	74	View larger version (38K):    FIG.
