0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	129	  To further assess the potential radial patterning defects exhibited by the conditional COUP-TFII-null mutants, we examined the differentiation of smooth muscle and enteric neurons of the mutant stomach at later development.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	130	 Immunostaining of -smooth muscle actin confirmed the presence of a thickened circular smooth muscle layer formation in both the fore-stomach (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	131	 3E,F) and hind-stomach of conditional mutant mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	132	 Moreover, submucosal extension of -smooth muscle actin positive cells in the mutant fore-stomach (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	133	 3F, white arrows) indicated precocious differentiation of smooth muscle cells.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	134	 To further demonstrate that the smooth muscle layer in the conditional mutant stomach is disorganized, semi-thin sections (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	135	 3I,J) and the ultrastructure (data not shown) of the stomachs from E15.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	136	 Again, circular smooth muscle layer of the conditional mutant stomach is disorganized (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	137	 3J) in comparison with the controls (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	138	5 as revealed by semi-thin sections.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	139	 However, cellular defects, other than the disorganization of cell layers, have not been observed (data not shown).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	140	5, an enteric neuron marker, showed an increased number of positively stained cells in the conditional mutant mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	141	 To ensure there is expansion of enteric neurons in the mutant stomach, an additional neuronal marker, TUJ1 (neuronal class III tubulin-ss) was employed in immunostaining.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	142	 An increase of TUJ1-positive cells is shown in the conditional mutant (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	143	 3N) in comparison with the littermate control (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Taken together, conditional ablation of COUP-TFII in the mesenchyme resulted in at least two patterning abnormalities, epithelium outgrowth and expansion of circular smooth muscle and enteric neuron, both radial-patterning defects of the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	145	 The fact that COUP-TFII is only deleted in the mesenchyme compartment but the epithelium of the mutant stomach is expanded, suggesting signals from the mesenchyme is essential for proper growth of the epithelium.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	146	Anteroposterior patterning of the stomach is altered in the COUP-TFII conditional null mutant The abnormal radial patterning of the stomach manifested by the COUP-TFII mutants prompted us to assess if other patterning defects were also present in the developing mutant stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	147	 A whole-mount view revealed dysmorphogenesis in the stomach of conditional mutants (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	148	 The anatomical demarcation between the stratifying fore-stomach epithelium and the columnar hind-stomach epithelium, referred to as `the limiting ridge' as indicated by broken line, begins to develop, forming a presumptive margin between the fore-stomach and hind-stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	149	 The size of the fore-stomach compartment and of the entire organ was noticeably reduced in the conditional mutants (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	150	 4C,D, white arrowheads indicate the junction of fore- and hind-stomach).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Detailed histological examination reveals abnormalities in both the epithelium and mesenchyme.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	152	 The glandular epithelium was thicker in mutants when compared with controls (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	153	 In control mice, the epithelium was thickest at the pyloric region (to the left of Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	154	 4E), and the thickness of the epithelium progressively decreased anteriorly (towards the right).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	155	 By contrast, the epithelium of conditional mutant mice remained thick even in more anterior regions (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	156	 The mesenchyme of the conditional mutant mice was also thickened.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	157	 The hind-stomach epithelium showed several invaginations in the control mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	158	 4G), while more extensive invagination associated with the thickened epithelial layer in the conditional mutant mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	159	 The morphological reduction of the fore-stomach and the extension of the hind-stomach suggest aberrant compartmentation of the stomach, a possible patterning defect in the anteroposterior axis.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	160	View larger version (103K):    Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	161	 Analysis of AP patterning defects in conditional COUP-TFII mutant stomach.

0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	172	 e, epithelium; sm, smooth muscle layer; fs, fore-stomach; hs, hind-stomach; oe, esophagus; d, duodenum.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	173	  Histological analysis of whole embryo sagittal sections were carried out to examine if indeed patterning of anteroposterior axis in the conditional mutant is perturbed, Analysis of E16.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	174	5 conditional mutants revealed an alteration in epithelial characteristics along the AP axis (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	175	 The proximal duodenum exhibited typical characteristics for this stage in both control (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	176	 5A) and conditional mutant mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	177	 However, the pylorus of conditional mutant mice exhibited a disorganized thickened circular smooth muscle layer, with an epithelium that resembled the epithelium of the duodenum and was devoid of vacuoles (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	178	 5F), unlike the highly vacuolated control (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	179	 The hind-stomach of controls had a simple columnar epithelium with few invaginations, and a tight circular smooth muscle layer (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	180	 By contrast, the hind-stomach of conditional mutant mice exhibited a vacuolated epithelium (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	181	 5G), resembling the pyloric region of control mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	182	 5B), with numerous invaginations and a thickened but disorganized circular smooth muscle layer.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	183	 In addition, a cell layer located distal to the circular smooth muscle layer (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	184	 5G, indicated by small arrows at the bottom), where enteric neurons are normally located, was expanded in the conditional mutants.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	185	 Finally, the fore-stomach epithelium begins to stratify at E16.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	186	5, with characteristic rough and deep infolding that was evident in the control mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	187	 The conditional mutant mice showed similar infolding, but epithelium did not show clear signs of stratification (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	188	 In fact, the fore-stomach epithelium of conditional mutant mice more closely resembled hind-stomach epithelium (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	189	 These observable morphological changes in the compartmentation of different regions of the stomach are consistent with the notion that the stomach is posteriorized.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	190	View larger version (94K):    Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Morphological changes in the posteriorized conditional mutant stomach: E16.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	192	5 whole embryos were sectioned sagittally and stained with Hematoxylin and Eosin for histological assessment.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	193	 Corresponding regions in mutant and control were estimated by morphological characteristics of mesenchyme of each regions and relative location against other anatomical structures.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	194	 Oblique arrows across control and conditional mutant panels indicate changes of epithelial characteristics in the conditional mutants.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	195	 e, epithelium; sm, smooth muscle layer.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	196	  Alteration of AP patterning in the fore-stomach If AP patterning of the stomach is indeed disrupted in the conditional mutant, it is anticipated that the specification/differentiation of gastric epithelium might be affected.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	197	 To assess if the fore-stomach is altered, we examined the fore-stomach regions using the stratified epithelial cell marker cytokeratin 14 (CK14).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	198	 Immunostaining using CK14-specific antibody showed intense staining in the E16.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	199	5 control fore-stomach and the very anterior region of the mutant fore-stomach (data not shown).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	200	 CK14 staining remained as intense throughout the fore-stomach of the control (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	201	 However, it was barely detectable in the more caudal regions of the presumptive fore-stomach of the mutant (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	202	 6B), suggesting that the mutant stomach is posteriorized in which only the very anterior region of the stomach epithelium is stratified and expresses CK14, while the hind-stomach is morphologically expanded and is non-stratified.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	203	View larger version (113K):    Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	204	 Marker gene analyses confirm morphological changes in the conditional mutant stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	205	5 sagittal sections were stained for stratified epithelial cell marker CK14.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	206	 Intense staining was found in the basal cells in the control (A), while only faint staining was observed in the anterior edge of fore-stomach of the COUP-TFII conditional mutant (B).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	207	5 embryos were cross-sectioned and Shh expressions in the fore-stomach were examined by section in situ hybridization using 35S-UTP labeled probes.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	208	 Positive signals were pseudo-colored (red) and overlaid on bright-field image of Hematoxylin staining.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	209	 (E-G) Paraffin sections of E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	210	5 stomachs were stained with anti-CK14 antibody.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	211	 CK14 staining (dark brown) remained as intense throughout the fore-stomach of the control (E) and mutant (F).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	212	 Again, it was barely detectable in the more caudal regions of the stomach of the mutant (G) in comparison with similar anatomical position of fore-stomach of the control (E).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	213	  Shh has been shown to be highly expressed in the fore-stomach and can serve as a fore-stomach marker.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	214	 In the controls, Shh is highly expressed in the fore-stomach and the expression extends into the hind-stomach (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	215	 By contrast, the expression of Shh is anteriorly restricted in the conditional mutant (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	216	 The anterior restriction of Shh expression observed in the conditional mutants is similar to that detected in the stomachs of Hoxa5 mutant, indicating posteriorization of the fore-stomach (Aubin et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	217	Similar result for CK14 staining was observed at the later stage of development.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	218	 CK14 staining remained as intense throughout the fore-stomach of the control and mutant at E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Again, it was barely detectable in the more caudal regions of the stomach of the mutant (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	220	 6G), in comparison with similar anatomical position of fore-stomach of the control (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	221	 This result further support the notion that the mutant stomach is posteriorized in which only the very anterior region of the stomach epithelium is stratified and expresses CK14, whereas the hind-stomach is expanded and is non-stratified.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	222	The expression of the differentiated hind-stomach markers remains unchanged in the conditional mutants As shown earlier, the radial patterning and the AP patterning of the stomach are altered in the mutants at E13.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	223	5, leading to the respective thickening of the epithelium and the expansion of the hind-stomach (Figs 3, 4, 5).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	224	 To examine if these phenotypes persist at later development, we examined the mutant stomach at E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Similar to early development, it is clear that the epithelium is thickened and the hind-stomach of the mutant is considerably expanded (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	226	 7B) in comparison with the controls (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	227	 To examine whether differentiation of the glandular epithelium is perturbed in the mutant, the expression of parietal cell marker H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit and of the glandular gastric epithelium marker GATA4 were analyzed at E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	228	 Although H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit positive parietal cells are present in the glandular gastric epithelium of both controls (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	229	 7C) and conditional mutant mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	230	 7D), the number of the parietal cells were increased in the thickened epithelial layer of the conditional mutant mice (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	231	 The expression of GATA4 in the thickened glandular epithelial layer of the mutant (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	232	 7F) is similar to that of the controls (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	233	 7E), suggesting differentiation of the glandular epithelium is unchanged in the mutant.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	234	View larger version (71K):    Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	235	 (A,B) Dissected stomachs from E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	236	5 embryos were longitudinally sectioned and stained with Hematoxylin and Eosin.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	237	 The thickness of the glandular epithelium is increased in the mutant stomach compared with the littermate control.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	238	 (C-F) The adjacent tissue sections between fore-stomach and hind-stomach were stained by anti-H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit antibody (C,D) and anti-GATA4 (E,F) antibodies.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	239	 The transition zone between oxyntic mucosa (os) and stratified squamous epithelium (sse) of the fore-stomach are indicated by arrows.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	240	 (G-T) Marker gene analyses in the adult stomachs: (G-L) Sections (4  microm) prepared from the stomachs of 35-day-old mice were staining with Hematoxylin and Eosin.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	241	 The histological morphology of zymogenic region (G,H), mucoparietal zone (I,J) and pure mucus zone (K,L) showed no obvious difference in the conditional mutant stomach (H,J,L) and littermate control (G,I,K).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	242	 (M,N) The secreted glycoprotein of the zymogenic zone of stomachs was visualized by PAS staining and no discernable difference was observed in the conditional mutant stomach (N) and littermate control (M).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	243	 (O,P) The gastric parietal cells were stained with anti-H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit antibody.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	244	 (Q,R) The neck and pre-neck cells (red) at the gastric units showed no difference in the control (Q) and conditional mutant (R) stomachs.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	245	 (S,T) Anti-GATA4 antibody was used to mark glandular gastric epithelium.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	246	 Positive signals were found in base of glandular gastric epithelium at pure mucus zone in the control (S) and the mutant (T).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	247	  To further substantiate that differentiation of the hind-stomach is largely intact in the mutant, we examined the mutant hind-stomach at adulthood.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	248	 Histological analysis of the stomachs from 35-day-old of mutant mice and littermate controls showed no obvious difference in the hind-stomachs at the regions of Zymogenic zone (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	249	 7 I,J) and pure mucus zone (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	250	 7K,L) by Hematoxylin and Eosin.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Mucins secretion was analyzed by periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) staining and similar PAS staining was observed in both control (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	252	 To further examine if there is any changes in cell specification in the mutant hind-stomach, we employed H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit as the parietal cells marker (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	253	 7O,P), GSII as the neck and pre-neck cell marker (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	254	 7Q,R) and GATA4 as marker in the base of the pure mucus unit (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	255	 The expression profiles of all these markers are similar in the mutants when compared with the controls.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	256	 These results, taken together, support the notion that there are no cell type changes in the conditional mutant in comparison with littermate control throughout development even though there are observable patterning defects in the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	257	Alteration in the very caudal part of the mutant hind-stomach As histological analysis indicated that the very caudal part of the hind-stomach might have acquired pylorus characteristics, we used alkaline phosphatase (EAP) to determine whether hind-stomach is indeed posteriorized.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	258	 8A, EAP is mainly expressed in the duodenum and pylorus region of the controls.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	259	 By contrast, high level of EAP expression not just found in the duodenum and pylorus, but it was also found in the hind-stomach of conditional mutant mice using longitudinally sectioned E16.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	260	 Clear anterior extension of EAP-positive epithelium, as indicated by brackets, was found in the hind-stomach of conditional mutant mice.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	261	 Although expression of the markers H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	262	 8E,F) is no different in the regions anterior to the junction of the pylorus and duodenum from E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	263	 8D,F) stomachs, the higher level of EAP activity was again found in the mutant hind-stomach (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	264	 Taken together, the extended and high levels of EAP expression in the hind-stomach again indicate that patterning of the AP axis is abnormal in the conditional mutants.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	265	View larger version (92K):    Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	266	 (A,B) Paraffin sections of E16.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	267	5 stomachs were stained for EAP activity.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	268	 The bracket indicates corresponding regions of the caudal end of control and mutant stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	269	 oe, esophagus; Py, pylorus; d, duodenum.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	270	 (C,D) The junction region of the caudal end of the stomach and the duodenum show slight morphological differences.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	271	 The gastric parietal cells were stained with anti-H+/K+-ATPase ss-subunit antibody.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	272	 (E,F) Anti-GATA4 antibody was used to mark glandular gastric epithelium.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	273	 (G-J) Paraffin sections of E18.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	274	5 stomachs were stained for EAP activity.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	275	 The bracket indicates corresponding regions of the caudal end of control and mutant stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	276	 Very low positive signals were found in glandular gastric epithelium of the control (G,I) while highly intense signals were seen in the mutant (H,J).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	277	 High magnification of the boxed corresponding regions in the control (G) and mutant (H) were shown in I and J, respectively.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Scale bar in B: 100  microm for A,B.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	279	  Does COUP-TFII mediate Hh signaling in the stomach? The radial and AP patterning defects elicited by the COUP-TFII-null mutants bear resemblance to the dysmorphogenesis of the stomach in Shh-null mutant mice (Ramalho-Santos et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	280	 Because of this similarity, we asked if COUP-TFII expression is altered in the Shh-null mutant.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	281	 Whole-mount in situ hybridization showed that COUP-TFII expression in the caudal region of the stomach of the Shh-null mutant is downregulated in comparison with the control littermate.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	282	 However, the expression of COUP-TFII in other regions of the stomach is only slightly downregulated (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	283	 An anterior shifting of the caudal margin of COUP-TFII expression at the gastro-duodenal junction (indicated by broken lines; presumptive gastro-duodenal junction is indicated by arrowheads based on morphology and location of the dorsal mesogastrium) was evident in the Shh-null mutant.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	284	 In addition, a significant size reduction, particularly in the fore-stomach was noted in the Shh-null mutant stomachs, even as early as E12.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	285	5 stage, using the esophagus as a guide (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	286	View larger version (86K):    Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	287	 Effect of inhibition of Hh signaling in COUP-TFII expression.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	288	 (A,B) Developing stomachs were dissected from E12.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	289	5 Shh wild-type and null mutant, and expression of COUP-TFII mRNA was detected by whole-mount in situ hybridization.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	290	 Caudal margins of COUP-TFII expression are indicated by dots, and presumptive anatomical boundaries between stomach and duodenum are indicated by arrowheads.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	291	 The relative size of fore-stomach is indicated by a white line at the top of the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	292	 (C-F) Foregut explants were dissected from E10.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	293	5 knock-in embryos and cultured for 48 hours in increasing concentrations of cyclopamine (0-10  microM, D-F).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	294	 Strong lacZ expression was detected in the mesenchyme between lung bud and fore-stomach, as indicated by arrowhead, and cyclopamine inhibited lacZ expression in a dose-dependent manner.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	295	 oe, esophagus; fs, fore-stomach; hs, hind-stomach; dmg, dorsalmesogastrium; lb, lung bud; St, stomach; Py, pylorus; d, duodenum; e, hind-stomach epithelium.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	296	  As the presence of Ihh in the Shh-null mutant stomach (Bitgood and McMahon, 1995) might functionally compensate for Shh and influence COUP-TFII expression, we used cyclopamine to inhibit all Hh signals (Chen et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	297	, 2002) and asked if COUP-TFII expression is affected in the explants organ culture.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	298	5 lacZ knock-in embryos were cultured for 48 hours in the presence of increasing amounts of cyclopamine.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	299	 Whole-mount X-gal staining of COUP-TFII illustrated a significant dose-dependent reduction of COUP-TFII/lacZ expression, especially in the mesenchyme between lung bud and fore-stomach (indicated by arrowheads) (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	300	 At 1  microM of cyclopamine, a slight reduction of COUP-TFII mRNA, as represented by X-gal staining, was detected in the stomach explants from E11.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	301	 At 5  microM and 10  microM of cyclopamine, the reduction of X-gal staining was more pronounced in the stomach when compared with the controls (Fig.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	302	 9E,F), while COUP-TFII mRNA was not affected in lung explants (not shown).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	303	 The downregulation of COUP-TFII expression when Hh signaling is inhibited by cyclopamine substantiates the notion that Hh signaling regulates COUP-TFII expression in the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	304	Conditional ablation of COUP-TFII in the mesenchyme of the developing stomach by Nkx3.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	305	2 Cre recombinase firmly established that COUP-TFII is essential for radial patterning of the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	306	5, it is already apparent that the circular smooth muscles layers and the enteric neurons layers are expanded and disorganized in the conditional mutants.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	307	 These defects persist at later stages of development.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	308	 Although COUP-TFII in the epithelial compartment has not been deleted, the epithelium is considerably thicker in comparison with the control littermates, indicating signals from the mesenchyme are required for appropriate epithelium growth.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	309	 The defects display by the COUP-TFII conditional mutants indicate that COUP-TFII is essential for radial patterning of the developing stomach and these defects are not seen in the compound heterozygote of Nkx3.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	310	 Instead, the inappropriate differentiation of the smooth muscles cells and enteric neurons in the mesenchyme has been shown when Hh signaling is disrupted by treatment with cyclopamine (Sukegawa et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	311	 Shh is believed to be the epithelial signal that inhibits the gut mesenchyme to differentiate into smooth cells and the neural crest cells to differentiate into enteric neurons.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	312	 Our findings indicate that COUP-TFII participates in the negative regulation of differentiation of smooth muscle cells and enteric neurons in the gut mesenchyme.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	313	 COUP-TFII can either serve as a downstream target of Hh to mediate its negative function in the gut mesenchyme or exert its effect in a pathway parallel to Hh to regulate mesenchymal differentiation.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	314	In addition to radial patterning of the stomach, COUP-TFII is also required for AP patterning of the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	315	 The anterior shift of the limited ridge that divides the fore- and hind-stomach, the reduced size of the fore-stomach, the expansion of the hind-stomach and the expansion of EAP expression into the hind-stomach are all consistent with disruption of the AP axis patterning in the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	316	 However, the differentiation of the epithelium of the fore- and hind-stomach in the adult mutant remains unchanged; with all the molecular markers analyzed, even the mutant stomach is posteriorized.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	317	 The posteriorization and ectopic extended expression of EAP in the hind-stomach of the conditional mutant have been demonstrated in the Shh-null mutant mice (Ramalho-Santos et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	318	 The striking similarity of the phenotypes exhibited by conditional COUP-TFII-null mutants and animals, chick and mouse, when Hh signaling is disrupted further implicates that Hh and COUP-TFII act in the same and/or parallel pathways.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	319	Although the general slight reduction of expression of COUP-TFII in the Shh-null mutant is a little surprising, the high expression of Ihh in the expanded hind-stomach of the Shh-null mutant could have compensated for the missing Shh to induce COUP-TFII expression.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	320	 Indeed, the downregulation of COUP-TFII expression in the mesenchyme of the stomach is more pronounced in the explants treated with cyclopamine, supporting the notion that COUP-TFII is a downstream target of Hh signaling.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	321	 In addition, Shh signaling can directly activate COUP-TFII expression and Shh-N activates COUP-TFII expression in P19 cells without de novo protein synthesis (Krishnan et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	322	 Furthermore, analysis of the COUP-TFII promoter has identified an ShhRE that is distinct from the defined Gli-binding site (Krishnan et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	323	 Thus, all the above results indicate that COUP-TFII mediates Hh signaling in the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	324	 Taken together, our results established that COUP-TFII is essential for radial and AP patterning of the stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	325	 Restriction of anterior Shh expression and attenuation of Shh action in the epithelium of the COUP-TFII conditional mutant, in turn, suggests a potential role for COUP-TFII in the stimulation or maintenance of Shh expression.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	326	Shh derived from the epithelium signals the mesenchyme of the stomach, but how mesenchymal factors influence endodermally expressed Shh is unclear.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	327	 The Hoxa5-null mutant phenotype provides evidence for mesenchyme-mediated regulation of Shh expression in the developing stomach (Aubin et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	328	 Similarly in chick, it was suggested that adjacent mesenchyme regulates Shh expression (Narita et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	329	 In our study, COUP-TFII was ablated in the mesenchyme and the observed dysmorphogenesis suggests that COUP-TFII potentially affects such mesenchymal factor(s).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	330	 One such candidate, Bmp4, which belongs to the TGFss superfamily, is expressed in the mesenchyme of developing murine stomach, while the chick ortholog has been demonstrated to play a role in gizzard patterning.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	331	 Bmp4 is important for mesoderm development, but because of early lethality in Bmp4-null mutants, no specific role for Bmp4 in gastric development has been elucidated (Winnier et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	332	 Interestingly, it has been shown that COUP-TFII binds to the mouse Bmp4 promoter and regulates Bmp4 promoter activity in transient transfection assays (Feng et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	333	, 1995), suggesting COUP-TFII might function through BMP signaling.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	334	 Another member of TGFss super family, activin, governs embryonic axial patterning, and restricts Shh expression in Hensen's node (Monsoro-Burq and Le Douarin, 2001).
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	335	 Furthermore, the expansion of Shh expression domain within the stomach of Acvr2a/Acvr2b mutant mice indicates a restriction of Shh in the foregut that is potentially regulated by TGFss/Bmp signaling.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	336	 As Acvr2 is able to interact with BMPs (Kim et al.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	337	, 2000), mesenchymal expressed Bmp4 may restrict Shh expression.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	338	 Alternatively, it is possible that COUP-TFII may modulate the expression of activin/activin receptor themselves.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	339	 Enhanced activin signaling may restrict the expression domain of Shh to the anterior border and perturb the epithelial growth, as seen in the conditional mutant stomach.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	340	 Further analysis of TGFss/Bmp/activin signaling in the COUP-TFII conditional mutant stomach may shed light on which mesenchymal factor(s) that regulate Shh expression are affected by the absence of COUP-TFII.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	341	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   We thank Xiaoyan Huang, Kikue Takamoto and Wei Qian for excellent technical help; Dr Milton Finegold, Mr James Barrish and the Core Morphology laboratory of the NIH Gulf Coast Digestive Disease Center for the thin-section and the EM analysis; Drs Zijian Lan, Hong Wu and Dennis Roop for various suggestion and discussion; Drs Kimi Araki, Takeshi Yagi and Matthew Scott for plasmid DNA; and Kurt Schillinger, Debra Bramblett and Peter Tsai for preparation of manuscript.

0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	367	 Hedgehog signals regulate multiple aspects of gastrointestinal development.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	368	 The concentric structure of the developing gut is regulated by Sonic hedgehog derived from endodermal epithelium.
0.25421372.15829524.html.plaintext.txt	369	 Bapx1: an evolutionary conserved homologue of the Drosophila bagpipe homeobox gene is expressed in splanchnic mesoderm and the embryonic skeleton.
