0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	360	HOME HELP FEEDBACK SUBSCRIPTIONS ARCHIVE SEARCH TABLE OF CONTENTS  All ASBMB Journals   Molecular and Cellular Proteomics   Journal of Lipid Research   Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Education  Copyright   2005 by the American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	0	Stat 5b and the Orphan Nuclear Receptors Regulate Expression of the 2-Macroglobulin (2M) Gene in Rat Ovarian Granulosa Cells Maya Dajee, Georg H.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	1	) Baylor College of Medicine Houston, Texas 77030 Department of Genetics (G.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	2	) Institute for Microbiology, Biochemistry and Genetics Friedrich-Alexander University D91058 Erlanger-Nurenberg, Germany.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	3	When granulosa cells luteinize, they respond to a different set of extracellular signals, one of which is the cytokine PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	4	 In the ovary (10, 11, 12), as in other target tissues (13, 14, 15), PRL activates the JAK (Janus kinase)/STAT (signal transducers and activators of transcription) pathway.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	5	 One gene that is selectively regulated by PRL in luteal cells encodes 2-macroglobulin (2M), a large tetrameric protein that traps and inactivates proteases and cytokines.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	6	 The inducibility of this gene by interleukin-6 (IL-6) in rat liver (16) and by PRL in rat luteal cells (11) has provided a unique opportunity to delineate the cellular signaling mechanisms used by each cytokine to control the tissue-specific expression of this gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	7	 In previous analyses, we have shown that Stat 5 is activated by PRL and binds to specific -activating sequences (GAS) sites present in the promoter of the 2M gene and originally referred to as the IL-6 response element (IL6-RE) based on the activation of this gene by IL-6 in rat liver (16).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Because a luciferase reporter construct containing 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	9	2 kb of the 2M promoter showed high basal activity when transfected into differentiated granulosa cells in the absence of PRL, we sought to identify additional factors involved in regulating the promoter of this gene and the extent to which the high basal as well as PRL inducibility were dependent on hormone-induced differentiation of granulosa cells in culture (10).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	10	As a result of additional analyses of the 2M promoter, we observed that when a 109-bp region directly 3' of the Stat 5-binding sites was deleted, the 2M promoter-reporter construct lost both its high basal activity and PRL-regulated induction.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	11	 When the sequence of this region was examined, we noted that it contained putative binding sites for SF-1 and chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factor (COUP-TF).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Like SF-1, COUP-TF is a member of the orphan nuclear receptor superfamily (17, 18).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	13	 However, unlike SF-1, it is presumed to be expressed ubiquitously and has been shown to exhibit complex interactions by binding, as a heterodimer, other members of the nuclear receptor superfamily (19).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	14	 COUP-TF homodimers bind to a wide spectrum of response elements containing, as a core half-site, the A/GGGTCA motif, the spacing and orientation of which determine the relative binding affinity of COUP-TF (19).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Recent evidence indicates that Stat proteins may interact functionally with other transcription factors and coregulatory molecules, including members of the nuclear receptor superfamily (20, 21, 22, 23, 24).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	16	 Based on the close juxtaposition and functional activities of the PRL response element (PRLRE) and the putative orphan receptor-binding sites, it seemed reasonable to predict that factors binding to these regions might interact to control maximal expression of the 2M gene in granulosa-luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	17	Based on these considerations and the tissue- specific expression of this gene in the rat ovary, the following studies were undertaken to determine which Stat 5 proteins were present and functional in differentiated granulosa cells, if either SF-1 or COUP-TF bound to the intact 2M promoter, and if either SF-1 or COUP-TF interacted functionally with Stat 5 proteins to confer maximal expression of this gene in response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	18	 The functional activities of the Stat-binding sites and the orphan receptor-binding sites were analyzed by generating site-specific mutations in the context of the intact promoter and transfecting differentiated granulosa cells with specific intact and mutant promoter-luciferase reporter constructs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	19	 Activities were related to the binding of specific nuclear factors and the stage of differentiation of the granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	20	View larger version (20K):    Figure 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	21	 Two Regions of the 2M Promoter Are Required for Functional Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	22	Each of the indicated vectors was transfected in triplicate in differentiated granulosa cells that had been cultured in the presence of FSH (50 ng/ml) and testosterone (10 ng/ml) for 48 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	23	 After 4 h of incubation, PRL(1  microg/ml)was added for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	24	 Luciferase activity (light units) was measured in 20  microl cell lysate and normalized to the amount of protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	25	 The relative luciferase activity is represented as the mean (light units/ microg)  plus or minus  SEM.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	26	  Stat Binding Sites Are Critical for PRL Induction of the 2M Promoter To specifically determine the function of the Stat- binding sites in the context of the intact 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	27	2-kb 2M promoter, each of the Stat-binding sites was mutated or both of the sites were deleted.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	28	2-kb 2M construct and the mutant promoter-luciferase pSV constructs (16) were transfected into differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	29	 2, PRL induced a 2- to 3-fold increase in luciferase activity from the intact promoter-reporter construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	30	 Although the level of luciferase activity of the promoter in the pSV promoter-reporter constructs was low (as compared with the pGL3 constructs, Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	31	 1), the inducibility by PRL was similar.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	32	 Deletion of both Stat-binding sites or mutation of either site abolished inducibility by PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Basal activity was not markedly altered except for the reduced activity in the proximal Stat 5 mutant construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	34	 These results clearly show that both Stat- binding sites are required for PRL inducibility of promoter activity in granulosa cells but not for the high basal activity of the constructs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	35	View larger version (21K):    Figure 2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	36	 Both the Stat Factor-Binding Sites Are Required for the 2M Promoter Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	37	To determine the function of the Stat binding sites in the context of the endogenous intact promoter, either one of the Stat-binding sites was mutated or both were deleted.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	38	 These constructs were then transfected into differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	39	 Luciferase activity was measured in 20  microl cell lysate, normalized to the amount of protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	40	  PRL-Induced DNA-Binding Activity Contains Stat 5a and Stat 5b To determine the specific factors binding to the PRLRE, we used electrophoretic mobility shift assays (EMSAs) in which the labeled oligonucleotide probe consisted of two copies of the proximal Stat-binding site of the 2M promoter (2MGAS2) (16).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	41	 Because activated (phosphorylated) Stat proteins bind DNA whereas the nonphosphorylated Stats do not, the activated factors are readily detected in EMSAs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	42	 Accordingly, whole cell extracts (WCEs) were prepared from differentiated granulosa cells before or 15 min after PRL treatment, incubated with labeled 2M GAS2 probe, and resolved by electrophoresis.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	43	 One slow migrating protein/DNA complex was formed with the WCE from PRL-treated cells but was not observed in WCE prepared from untreated cells (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	44	 To identify the Stat factor(s) present in the slow migrating complex, WCEs were preincubated with antibodies to either Stat 5a or Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	45	 The PRL-induced complex was partially supershifted by the Stat 5a antibody, as shown previously (10).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	46	 A specific Stat 5b antibody resulted in retardation of the entire PRL-induced protein/DNA complex (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	47	 3A, asterisk) as was observed in extracts isolated from PRL-stimulated corpora lutea (11).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	48	 These data indicate that in differentiated granulosa-luteal cells, as in luteal tissue from pregnant rats (11, 12), PRL activates Stat 5b as well as Stat 5a and that Stat 5b is the predominant isoform in these cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	49	View larger version (54K):    Figure 3.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	50	 Activation and Phosphorylation of Stat5b in Differentiated Granulosa Cells by PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	51	A, PRL-induced DNA-binding activity present in granulosa cells contains Stat 5a and Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	52	 WCEs isolated from untreated and PRL-treated (15 min) granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonucleotide 2MGAS2 (5'- GATCATCC TTCTGGGAATTCTGATATCCTTCTGGGAATTCTG- 3') and analyzed on EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	53	 The arrow indicates the specific PRL-induced DNA protein complex formed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	54	 WCEs from PRL-treated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to Stat 5a and Stat 5b antibodies (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled double-stranded oligonucleotide 2MGAS2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	55	 The PRL-induced DNA-protein complex is super-shifted partially by the Stat 5a antibody and completely by Stat 5b antibody (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	56	 B and C, PRL induces tyrosine phosphorylation of Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	57	 For immunoprecipitations, 30  microl immobilized Protein A on tryacryl beads were incubated with 200  microg WCEs, for 1 h at 4 C with shaking.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	58	 After a brief spin, the supernatant was incubated with 1  microl Stat 5b antibody and 20  microl beads for 24 h at 4 C with shaking.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Each of the samples was then washed three times with WCE buffer to remove unbound proteins.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Bound proteins were eluted from the beads by addition of equal volume of SDS-loading buffer and boiled at 100 C for 10 min.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Samples were electrophoresed on a 10% SDS-polyacylamide gel, transferred to an immobilion membrane, and blotted with antiphosphotyrosine antibody (B).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	62	 The same blot was stripped and immunoblotted with anti-Stat 5b antibody (C).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	63	  PRL Induces Tyrosine Phosphorylation of Stat 5b To demonstrate that the activated Stat 5b in granulosa cells was phosphorylated as a consequence of PRL stimulation, immunoprecipitation experiments were performed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	64	 WCEs were prepared from granulosa cells before and at selected time points after PRL treatment.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	65	 WCEs were incubated with a specific Stat 5b antibody.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	66	 The immunoprecipitate was resolved by SDS-PAGE, and tyrosine-phosphorylated Stat 5b was identified by an antiphosphotyrosine antibody (PY20) used in the Western blotting procedure.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	67	 3B, WCEs from untreated cells do not contain detectable amounts of tyrosine-phosphorylated Stat 5b, whereas WCEs prepared within 15 min of PRL treatment contained significant levels of phospho-Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	68	 Phosphorylated Stat 5b remained present but at lower levels at 6 h and 20 h after PRL treatment (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	69	To ensure that relatively equal amounts of Stat 5b were present in each immunoprecipitate, the same blot was reprobed with an anti-Stat 5b antibody.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	70	 3C, similar amounts of Stat 5b were immunoprecipitated from each of the samples.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	71	 These data show that PRL rapidly stimulates tyrosine phosphorylation of Stat 5b in granulosa-luteal cells but that, even in the presence of continuous exposure to PRL, the amount of phospho-Stat 5b decreases progressively with time, coincident with reduced DNA-binding activity (data not shown and Ref.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	72	Stat 5b Is a Key Regulator of 2M Gene Expression in the Ovary Having established that Stat 5b, rather than Stat 5a, is the major Stat 5 protein activated in these granulosa-luteal cells and knowing that Stat 3 fails to bind the 2M PRLRE (10, 11), we sought to determine whether disruption of Stat 5b binding to the promoter would abolish promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	73	 For this we cotransfected into differentiated granulosa cells vectors expressing either wild-type Stat 5b or a truncated, splice variant form of Stat 5b (Stat 5b-40C) that has been shown to act in a dominant negative fashion to suppress Stat 5b function in other cells (25, 26).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	74	 A reporter construct containing four copies of the proximal Stat-binding site ligated to the minimal 2M promoter-luciferase gene (4XGAS 2M) was chosen as the reporter construct since in previous studies (10, 16) it has been shown to exhibit a greater response to PRL treatment than the intact 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	75	 When wild-type Stat 5b expression vectors were cotransfected with the 4XGAS 2M luciferase construct, the PRL-induced response was similar to cells cotransfected with the empty vector (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	76	 4), indicating that endogenous amounts of Stat 5b were already in excess.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	77	 In contrast, PRL-induced activation of the promoter-reporter construct was significantly repressed by cotransfection of the vector expressing the truncated variant of Stat 5b (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	78	 These data indicate that PRL induction of 2M in differentiated granulosa cells is dependent on activation of Stat 5b and that the truncated splice-variant of Stat 5b can act as a dominant negative factor in granulosa cells as it does in other cells (25, 26).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	79	View larger version (18K):    Figure 4.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	80	 Truncated Stat 5b Acts as a Dominant Negative Factor in Differentiated Granulosa Cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	81	Expression vectors of the long (Stat 5b) and truncated form (Stat 5b-40C) of Stat 5b were cotransfected as above with 4xGAS-2M promoter-reporter construct, containing four copies of the proximal Stat-binding site.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Luciferase activity is presented as the mean  plus or minus  SEM of activity obtained for each construct done in triplicate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	83	  SF-1 and COUP-TF Are Present in Granulosa Cells and Bind the Proximal Promoter of the 2M Gene The 109-bp fragment (-153/-43 bp) which, when deleted, totally abolished functional activity of promoter-reporter constructs (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	84	 1; -209 2M) was analyzed for potential transcription factor- binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	85	 Putative binding sites for orphan members of the nuclear transcription factor family, SF-1, and COUP-TF (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	86	 5A) were present in the 45-bp region of this fragment.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	87	 The sites for COUP-TF included an imperfect direct repeat (DR) separated by one nucleotide (designated DR1) and another direct repeat that contains a variant repeat of A/GGGTCA separated by two nucleotides, designated DR2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	88	 On the opposite strand between DR1 and DR2, a putative SF-1 site was identified that contains one nucleotide mismatch from the consensus hexameric sequence (CA)AGGTCA (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	89	 Based on sequence identity and the binding studies described below, we have referred to this region as the orphan receptor response element (ORRE).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	90	View larger version (52K):    Figure 5.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	91	 Sequence and Functional Binding Sites for COUP-TF and SF-1 in the 2M ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	92	A, Sequence comparison of the ORRE to consensus binding sites for members of the nuclear orphan receptor family.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	93	 The ORRE contains two potential COUP-TF binding sites designated direct repeats (DR), DR1 and DR2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	94	 The SF-1 binding site is present on the opposite strand between DR1 and DR2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Consensus sequences are represented in bold.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Identical nucleotides are indicated with lines.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	97	 B, SF-1 and COUP-TF bind the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	98	 WCEs obtained from differentiated granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonuleotide ORRE various cold competitors, as indicated, and analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	99	 The sequence of each oligonucleotide is described in Materials and Methods.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Arrows indicate the specific DNA protein complexes formed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	101	 WCEs from differentiated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to COUP-TF or SF-1 (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Antisera against COUP-TF reacts with Complex A and antisera against SF-1 reacts with complex B.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	103	 Supershifts are indicated by (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	104	  To determine whether these factors were present in the differentiated granulosa cells and could bind to the ORRE, EMSAs were performed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	105	 A 50 mer oligonucleotide spanning the ORRE was used as a labeled probe and incubated with WCE obtained from untreated and PRL-treated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	106	 Since identical complexes were observed with either WCE (data not shown), only the results obtained with WCE not exposed to PRL are presented (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	107	 As shown, two major protein/DNA complexes were formed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	108	 The slower migrating complex, designated complex A, consists of two bands (thin arrow); the faster migrating complex is designated complex B (thick arrow).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Formation of both these complexes was inhibited by the addition of 100-fold molar excess of unlabeled ORRE oligonucleotide, indicating that each of these complexes contains a protein(s) capable of binding to the probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	110	 When a 20-bp oligonucleotide encompassing a consensus COUP-TF-binding site (Materials and Methods) was added to the reaction, the formation of complex A but not complex B was abolished (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	111	 When oligonucleotides spanning either the putative COUP-TF-binding DR1 or DR2 regions (Materials and Methods) of the 2M promoter were added, neither altered the formation of complex A or complex B at the 100-fold molar excess.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	112	 However, when oligonucleotides containing both DR1 and SF-1 (DR1SF-1) or DR2 and SF-1 (DR2SF-1) (Materials and Methods) were added, each reduced the formation of complex A as well as complex B.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	113	To confirm the identification of proteins present in granulosa cell extracts, the WCEs were incubated with specific antisera to either COUP-TF or SF-1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	114	 Antisera to COUP-TF specifically supershifed both the bands of complex A (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	115	 Previous data show that this antiserum recognizes both COUP-TFI and COUP-TF-II (27).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	116	 This COUP-TF antiserum also diminished the binding of in vitro translated COUP-TF to ORRE (data not shown).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	117	 The SF-1- specific antiserum retarded complex B (*) but not complex A, indicating a specific interaction of the antibody to this major protein-DNA complex.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	118	 Collectively, these data indicate that the SF-1 (complex B) and COUP-TF (complex A) bind the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	119	 Furthermore, the functional binding sites appear to be overlapping rather than distinct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	120	Mutation of the SF-1 Binding Site Alters COUP-TF Binding to the ORRE To determine whether the nucleotides required for the binding of SF-1 and COUP-TF to the 2M promoter were overlapping, mutations within the ORRE were generated (Materials and Methods).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	121	 Mutations in both DR1 and DR2 (Mutant 1; M1) were made to selectively eliminate the putative binding sites of COUP-TF; mutations in the SF-1-binding site were generated to block the binding of SF-1 (M2) (Materials and Methods).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	122	 When EMSAs were performed with M1 as the labeled probe (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	123	 6A, left panel), one major complex was formed (arrow).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	124	 This complex was competed with 50-fold and 100-fold molar excess of unlabeled M1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	125	 The antibody to COUP-TF failed to affect the mobility of the major complex binding to M1, whereas the antibody to SF-1 supershifted the major complex (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	126	 These results indicate that mutations within DR1 and DR2 inhibited COUP-TF binding without altering the binding of SF-1 to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	127	View larger version (60K):    Figure 6.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	128	 Binding Characteristics of Mutant SF-1 and COUP-TF-Binding Regions.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	129	A, Analysis of mutant SF-1- and COUP-TF-binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	130	 WCEs obtained from differentiated granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonuleotide containing either mutation in both DR1 and DR2 (M1) or mutation in the SF-1 site (M2) and analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	131	 The sequences of both M1 and M2 are described in Materials and Methods.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	132	 Arrow indicates the specific DNA protein complex formed with M1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	133	 WCEs from differentiated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to COUP-TF/SF-1 (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled M1/M2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Supershift of the specific complex with antisera against SF-1 is indicated by (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	135	 B, Mutation of the SF-1 site alters the affinity of COUP-TF to ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	136	 WCEs obtained from differentiated granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonuleotide ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	137	 The oligonuleotide containing mutation in the SF-1 site (M2) was used as a cold competitor at various concentrations.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	138	 The arrow indicates the specific DNA protein complex formed with ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	139	 WCEs from differentiated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to COUP-TF (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	140	 Supershift of the specific complex with antisera against COUP-TF is indicated by (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	141	  When the SF-1 mutant (M2) oligonucleotide was used as the labeled probe in EMSAs, no specific protein-DNA complexes containing SF-1 or COUP-TF were observed (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	142	 The absence of SF-1 binding was expected.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	143	 However the absence of COUP-TF was unexpected because both DR1 and DR2 sites were intact.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Thus mutation of the SF-1 site altered not only the binding of SF-1 but also that of COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	145	 When labeled M2 was incubated with in vitro translated COUP-TF, the binding of COUP-TF was markedly diminished compared with the intact ORRE (data not shown).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	146	 Based on these observations, we concluded that the SF-1 site of the 2M promoter appeared to enhance, stabilize, or directly bind COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	147	To determine if the mutation of the SF-1 site within the 2M promoter altered the binding affinity of COUP-TF to the ORRE, additional EMSAs were run in which the intact 50-mer ORRE was used as the labeled probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	148	 As previously, unlabeled ORRE reduced the formation of complexes A and B whereas the COUP-TF antibody supershifted complex A but not complex B (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	149	 When the SF-1 mutant M2 oligonucleotide was used at 100-, 500-, and 1000-fold molar excess, no reduction in the binding of SF-1 was observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	150	 However, M2 did compete for the binding of COUP-TF (thin arrow), albeit less effectively than unlabeled ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	151	 A 1000-fold molar excess of M2 was required to achieve the same inhibition as a 100-fold molar excess of the intact ORRE (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	152	 These results indicate that mutation of the SF-1 site reduces the affinity or stability but does not completely prevent the binding of COUP-TF to the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	153	SF-1 and COUP-TF Exert Opposing Effects on the Functional Activity of the 2M Promoter SF-1 is known to be a positive regulator of many genes (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9), whereas the effects of COUP-TF are more complex and can be either positive or negative (17, 28).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	154	 In addition, both exhibit tissue-specific effects as indicated by the phenotypes of mutant mice lacking SF-1 (1) or COUP-TFI/II (Refs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	155	 To analyze the functional roles of SF-1 and COUP-TF in regulating activation of the 2M promoter, specific mutations that abolished the binding of SF-1 or COUP-TF (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	156	 6) were generated within the -3712M promoter-reporter construct using PCR- directed mutagenesis techniques (Materials and Methods).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	157	 These constructs were then transfected into differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	158	 After 4 h, cells were treated with/without PRL for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	159	 Luciferase activity was measured, normalized to the amount of protein present in the sample, and then expressed as activity/ microg protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	160	 As expected, PRL induced a 2- to 3-fold increase in luciferase activity from the intact -371 2M promoter-reporter construct (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	161	 Mutation of the SF-1 site (mSF-1) that prevents SF-1 binding and reduces the affinity of COUP-TF binding (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	162	 6A/B) markedly decreased basal activity of the reporter gene but did not prevent the 3-fold increase in response to PRL (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	163	 In contrast, the COUP-TF mutant (mCOUPTF) construct that retains an intact SF-1 binding site but fails to bind COUP-TF showed a 5-fold increase in basal promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Although the fold increase by PRL was somewhat reduced, an effect of PRL was observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	165	 When both the SF-1 and the COUP-TF sites (mSF-mCOUPTF) were mutated, basal and PRL-stimulated luciferase activities were similar to that of the intact promoter-reporter construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Collectively, these data document that within the ORRE of the 2M promoter, SF-1 acts as a positive regulator whereas COUP-TF acts as a repressor of transcriptional activation.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	167	 Combined with the data from the EMSAs, these results indicate that although mutation of the SF-1 site decreases the affinity of COUP-TF binding to the 2M promoter, COUP-TF binds this region (albeit with reduced affinity) and retains potent repressor activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	168	 Thus, both of these nuclear receptors appear to control the basal activity of the 2M promoter in granulosa-luteal cells but do not markedly alter the response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	169	View larger version (18K):    Figure 7.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	170	 SF-1 and COUP-TF Are Required for 2M Promoter Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	171	Mutations of specific bases within the SF-1- and/or COUP-TF-binding sites were generated using PCR mutagenesis technique.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	172	 Each of the indicated vectors was transfected in triplicate in differentiated granulosa cells as above.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	173	 Luciferase activity (lights units/ microg) is presented as the mean  plus or minus  SEM of activity obtained for each construct done in triplicate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	174	  Molecular Mechanisms by which FSH and T Control Expression of 2M in Granulosa Cells The identification of SF-1 and COUP-TF as factors binding to and regulating the functional activity of the ORRE of the 2M promoter prompted us to determine whether these factors regulated the basal activity of this promoter at different stages of granulosa cell differentiation.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Specifically, FSH has been shown to regulate the expression of numerous genes in granulosa cells that contain SF-1 binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	176	 The list of genes includes aromatase (6), P450scc (7), MIS (8), and, more recently, the receptor for PRL (31).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	177	 This latter observation indicated that not only the basal activity of 2M promoter, but also the PRL inducibility of 2M gene might be dependent on several aspects of FSH-mediated differentiation of granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	178	 Therefore, we analyzed and compared both basal and PRL- induced expression of 2M in immature granulosa cells and in cells differentiated in the presence of FSH and T.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	179	 The expression of the endogenous 2M gene has been compared with the activity of 2M promoter-luciferase-reported constructs transfected into similar immature and differentiated cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	180	 Furthermore, the expression of the endogenous gene and the transgene has been related to the expression of PRL receptors (PRLRs), activation of Stat 5, and the relative levels of SF-1 and COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	181	To analyze the expression of the endogenous gene, granulosa cells were isolated from estradiol-primed immature rats.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	182	 The cells were either cultured in serum-free medium without hormones for 24 h or were cultured with FSH/T for 48 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	183	 PRL was added to the hormone-free (undifferentiated) and hormone-induced (differentiated) cell cultures for 24 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	184	 Total RNA was isolated, and 2M transcripts were analyzed by Northern blots.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	185	 8A, 2M mRNA was not present in the undifferentiated cells in the absence or presence of PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	186	 In contrast, PRL did induce 2M mRNA in the differentiated cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	187	 Thus, in the absence of FSH/T, PRL is unable to stimulate transcription of the endogenous 2M gene, confirming previous studies in vivo (11) and in vitro (32, 33).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	188	View larger version (23K):    Figure 8.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	189	 FSH/T-Induced Differentiation of Granulosa Cells Is Required for Expression of 2M mRNA and Promoter Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	190	A, PRL fails to induce 2M transcripts in undifferentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Undifferentiated (-FSH/T, 24 h) and differentiated (+FSH/T, 48 h) granulosa cells were placed in culture, followed by addition of PRL (1  microg/ml, 24 h).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Total RNA (20  microg) was used for Northern blot analysis.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	193	 B, Functional activity of the 2M promoter is dependent on granulosa cell differentiation.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	194	 The -3712M construct was transfected in triplicate into granulosa cells that had been cultured in the presence or absence of FSH and T.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	195	 After 4 h of incubation, PRL (1  microg/ml) was added for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	196	 Luciferase activity (lights units/ microg) is presented as the mean  plus or minus  SEM of activity obtained for each construct done in triplicate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	197	  Similar cultures were then set up and transfected with the -3712M promoter-reporter construct to analyze the activity of these chimeric genes in the absence and presence of PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	198	 8B, basal luciferase activity of the -371 2M promoter-reporter construct was low in undifferentiated granulosa cells and was not increased by the addition of PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	199	 In contrast, basal luciferase activity was 10-fold higher in the differentiated cells, and PRL induced a further 2- to 3-fold increase in activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	200	 The marked differences in the activity of the transgene in these two stages of granulosa cell differentiation were not related to transfection efficiency since an SV40 enhancer-promoter construct gave similar activity (20,000 mean light units  plus or minus  SEM per  microg protein) when transfected into each culture.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	201	 Based on these observations that FSH- and T-induced differentiation altered both basal and PRL-regulated activities, we sought to determine what changes in the PRL-response system or in the ratio of SF-1 and COUP-TF might account for these marked differences.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	202	To determine whether PRL could stimulate activation of Stat 5b/5a in undifferentiated granulosa cells, WCEs were isolated from FSH/T-treated (48 h) or untreated (24 h) granulosa cells before and after PRL treatment (15 to 30 min).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	203	 Several protein/DNA complexes were formed when WCE prepared from immature granulosa cells before and after their exposure to PRL were added to the labeled 2MGAS2 probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	204	 However, only extracts prepared within 15 min after PRL addition to FSH/T-treated cells (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	205	 9A) formed a specific slow migrating complex, which is composed primarily of Stat 5b with lesser amounts of Stat 5a (Figs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	206	 Immunoblot analysis using WCEs prepared from FSH/T treated (48 h) or untreated (24 h) granulosa cells before and after PRL treatment (15/30 min), and Stat 5b antibody shows similar levels of protein in both the immature and the FSH/T-stimulated cells (data not shown).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Thus, although Stat 5b protein is present in undifferentiated granulosa cells, PRL is unable to activate it in these cells (i.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	208	View larger version (43K):    Figure 9.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	209	 PRL Receptor Activity and mRNA Content in Undifferentiated and Differentiated Granulosa Cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	210	A, PRL fails to activate Stat 5b in undifferentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	211	 WCEs were isolated from cultured granulosa cells before and after PRL treatment (15 min) from undifferentiated (-FSH/T, 24 h) or differentiated (+FSH/T, 48 h) cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	212	 WCEs were incubated with a radiolabeled, double-stranded oligonucleotide 2MGAS2 as above.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	213	 The protein/DNA complexes were analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	214	 B, Expression of PRLR mRNAs in undifferentiated and differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	215	 RNA was isolated from uncultured, undifferentiated (-FSH/T, 24 h) and differentiated (+FSH/T, 48 h) granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	216	 Specific primers to the long and the short form of the PRLRs were used in a RT-PCR assay using 350 ng RNA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	217	 PCR amplification was performed for 20 cycles as described in Materials and Methods.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	218	 PCR products were resolved on a nondenaturing gel and quantified using Storm860 PhosphoImager.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	219	  One explanation for the transactivation of 2M in differentiated cells, but not in immature cells, is the level of PRLRs in these cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	220	 Three forms of the PRLRs have been identified in the rat.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	221	 The short receptor is an alternatively spliced product of the long form (L-PRLR).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	222	 The Nb2 form expressed in T cells is identical to L-PRLR but lacks 198 aa in the cytoplasmic domain.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Studies have shown the long form to be functional in the ovary.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Specific primers to the long and the short form of the PRLRs were used in an RT-PCR assay using RNA isolated from uncultured cells, undifferentiated granulosa cells (-FSH/T, 24 h), and differentiated cells (+FSH/T, 48 h).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	225	 The amplified receptor mRNA products were normalized to the endogenous ribosomal L19-amplified band (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	226	 The long form of the PRLR was detected at significant levels in immature granulosa cells before culture.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	227	 However, in the absence of hormone, the levels of PRLR decreased progressively at 24 and 48 h of culture (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	228	 In contrast, cells cultured with FSH/T for 48 h expressed 5-fold more message for the long PRLR and exhibited detectable amounts of the short form of the receptor (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	229	 These data indicate that the ability of PRL to induce 2M in these differentiated cells is related, in part, to the induction-maintenance of PRLR in these cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	230	 However, since PRL does not induce 2M in immature cells that also express the long form of the PRLR, additional factors regulating either the PRL-signaling cascade or the A-kinase system must be regulated by FSH/T as the granulosa cells differentiate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	231	Based on the opposing actions of SF-1 and COUP-TF in regulating the basal activity (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	232	 7), we sought to determine whether changes in the relative amounts of these factors might be related to increase of 2M mRNA expression in differentiated cells compared with immature cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	233	 EMSAs were performed using labeled ORRE and extracts prepared from either immature/undifferentiated granulosa cells (in which 2M is not induced) or from FSH/T- treated/differentiated granulosa cell extracts (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	234	 Quantification of the specific complexes was performed to determine the relative amounts of the SF-1 and COUP-TF binding to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	235	 10B), a relative increase in SF-1 binding (6-fold) compared with COUP-TF was detected in the FSH/T-treated granulosa-lutein cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	236	 These results indicated that a relative increase in the positive regulator SF-1 may enhance the basal promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	237	View larger version (28K):    Figure 10.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Levels of SF-1 and COUP-TF-Binding Activity in Undifferentiated and Differentiated Granulosa Cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	239	A, Relative increase in SF-1 and COUP-TF binding to the ORRE in differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	240	 WCEs obtained from immature and differentiated (FSH/T, 48 h) granulosa cells were incubated with labeled ORRE oligonuleotide.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	241	 The protein/DNA complexes were analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	242	 B, Quantitative representation of SF-1 and COUP-TF binding to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	243	 The SF-1 and COUP-TF protein/DNA complexes were quantified with Storm860 PhosphoImager.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	244	 FSH-dependent differentiation of granulosa cells increases the relative amount of SF-1 binding to the ORRE compared with COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	245	 Ratios (relative units) of SF-1 to COUP-TF binding are indicated in parentheses.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	246	When the studies described herein were originally initiated, we had shown that Stat 5a was expressed in rat granulosa cells, activated by PRL, and bound to the PRLRE of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	247	 We have extended these observations by showing that both Stat-binding sites are critical for PRL-induced activity of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	248	 Neither site alone in the context of the intact promoter exhibits significant functional activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	249	 These results indicate that the two sites may interact to stabilize or increase the binding of coregulatory molecules that interact with the transcriptional machinery.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	250	 As new information about the complexity of the Stat 5 family of transcription factors was reported (34, 35), reagents to these new family members allowed us to extend our initial observations.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Using antibodies specific for Stat 5b, we show that not only is it present in the rat granulosa cells, it is expressed at higher levels than Stat 5a, is activated by PRL, and binds to the PRLRE of the 2M gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	252	 These results obtained in granulosa-luteal cells in culture support those observed in luteal cells in vivo (10, 11).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Antibodies to Stat 5b have allowed us to document that in differentiated granulosa cells Stat 5b is tyrosine phosphorylated and translocated to the nucleus in response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	254	 In addition, truncated, splice-variant forms of Stat proteins have been cloned.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	255	 For the Stats in which truncated forms have been identified, Stat 1 (36, 37) Stat 3 (38), and Stat 5 (25, 26), the mutants lacking the transactivation domain have been shown to exert dominant-negative functions in transcription assays (25, 26, 36, 37, 38).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	256	 When we coexpressed the truncated Stat 5b variant with the 2M promoter-luciferase reporter construct, PRL-induced activity was markedly impaired, supporting the hypothesis that Stat 5 is the major PRL-regulated activator of 2M promoter activity in the differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Taken together, our results provide evidence that PRL-mediated signaling events that transactivate the 2M gene in the granulosa-luteal cells occur by mechanisms similar to those that regulate cytokine signal transduction of target gene activity in other tissues, such as mammary gland (13, 39, 40) and liver (35, 41).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	258	 That Stat 5, especially Stat 5b, plays a major role in transducing PRL action in ovarian cells has been supported recently by the generation of mutant mice.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Although female mice null for Stat 5a do not exhibit an overt ovarian phenotype (42), mice null for Stat 5b alone (43) are infertile and exhibit abnormal ovarian functions.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	260	 Based on the luteal cell-specific expression of 2M in vivo as well as its regulation by PRL and Stat 5b in cultured cells, we predict that corpora lutea of the infertile mice either fail to express 2M or express it at a markedly reduced level.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	261	Our results have also provided new evidence to indicate that other regions, in addition to the PRLRE, regulate the expression of 2M in granulosa-luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	262	 The region directly 3' of the PRLRE binds both SF-1 and COUP-TF and has been designated herein as the ORRE of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	263	 When this region of the 2M promoter was deleted, leaving the PRLRE intact, transgene activity was reduced to baseline and PRL inducibility was abolished.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	264	 Based on these initial observations, we predicted that Stat 5 binding to the PRLRE interacted synergistically with the orphan receptors binding to the 3'- regulatory region to confer maximal promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	265	 This initial hypothesis was supported by observations of others who have shown that Stats synergistically interact with a variety of other transcription factors and coregulatory molecules.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	266	 In mammary epithelial cells, Stat 5 interacts with the glucocorticoid receptor for activation of the ss-casein gene by PRL (23, 44).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	267	 In liver cells, Stat 3 synergizes (interacts) with glucocorticoid receptor for activation of the 2M gene by IL-6 (24).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	268	 Stat 1 and Sp1 interact to activate ICAM-I promoter in human tracheobronchial epithelial cells (21).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	269	 In addition, Stat 2 has been shown to bind CBP/p300 and enhance gene activation by interferon- (20).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	270	 When site-specific mutations were generated in either the Stat 5, SF-1, or COUP-TF binding sites within the context of the intact 2M promoter, a different set of functional interactions was observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	271	Mutation of either one or both Stat 5-binding sites markedly reduced PRL inducibility.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	272	 As mentioned above, these results indicate that the functional activity of the PRLRE is dependent on the binding of Stat 5 to each site and that these two sites interact to confer maximal PRL inducibility.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	273	 However, mutation of the Stat sites did not alter the high basal activity observed with the intact 2M promoter-reporter constructs compared with the -48 2M minimal promoter construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	274	 Contrary to our initial hypothesis, these results indicated that the Stat sites acted independently of the factors binding to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	275	 However, when site-specific mutations of the SF-1 site or the two COUP-TF binding sites were generated, marked changes in the basal activities of the mutant constructs were observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	276	 The mutant SF-1 construct that failed to bind SF-1 exhibited markedly reduced basal activity, whereas the COUP-TF mutant construct that failed to bind COUP-TF, but did bind SF-1, exhibited elevated basal activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	277	 These results indicated that SF-1 is a transcriptional activator and enhances 2M promoter activity, whereas COUP-TF acted as a corepressor to antagonize the activity of SF-1 and thereby reduce the functional activity of the intact 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Thus, the 2M gene can be added to a growing list of genes that are regulated by SF-1 in ovarian cells and highlights the importance of SF-1 in many diverse functions within the gonads and adrenals as suggested by the phenotype of mice null for SF-1 (1).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	279	 Furthermore, these observations provide the first evidence that COUP-TF is present and functional in ovarian granulosa cells and can regulate the expression of an ovarian gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	280	 Although the actions of COUP-TF are complex and have been shown to be both stimulatory and inhibitory (17), our data indicate that COUP-TF acts as a corepressor of SF-1 action in the intact promoter of the 2M gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	281	 This observation supports results obtained by one other study in which the effects of SF-1 were blunted by COUP-TF (5).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	282	Although the mechanism by which COUP-TF blocks the actions of SF-1 on the 2M promoter have not been entirely defined, our data show an interesting juxtaposition and interaction of SF-1- and COUP-TF-binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	283	 Of note, mutation of the SF-1 site reduced by 10-fold the binding affinity of COUP-TF for the DR1 and DR2 regions of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	284	 From this, we conclude that the binding of COUP-TF to DR1 and DR2 overlaps the SF-1 site or adjacent sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	285	 However, despite the dramatic reduction in the binding affinity of COUP-TF to the SF-1 mutant region, COUP-TF retained potent repressor activity as revealed by the markedly reduced basal activity of the SF-1 mutant construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	286	 These interactions of SF-1 and COUP-TF indicate that any change in the relative levels or activity of these factors could markedly alter the basal activity of the 2M gene and thus its expression.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	287	Both PRLRE and ORRE are dependent on the differentiation of granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	288	 In the case of the PRLRE, granulosa cell differentiation is obligatory, in part, because of the increased expression of PRLRs on the cell surface.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	289	 Increased PRLR number enhances the activation of Stat 5b, which is constituitively expressed in the same amount in immature as well as differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	290	 In the case of the ORRE, the molecular basis for the enhanced activity of this region in differentiated cells, as opposed to immature cells, remains to be determined but likely involves altered functional activity and complex interactions of SF-1 or COUP-TF on the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	291	 As shown herein, the amounts and relative ratios of these two factors binding to the 2M ORRE are different in immature and differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	292	 There is a relative 6-fold increase in SF-1 binding in differentiated granulosa cells compared with the immature granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	293	 Therefore, increased basal activity of the 2M promoter may depend on the increased binding of this transcriptional activator.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	294	 In addition, functional changes are likely to involve the selective phosphorylation of either factor or a coregulatory molecule.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Phosphorylation of SF-1 would be predicted to increase activity of the ORRE, whereas phosphorylation of COUP-TF might decrease its repressor activity on the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	296	 The phosphorylation of either factor might alter the recruitment of other coregulatory molecules.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	297	 Phosphorylation of SF-1 has been shown to occur in differentiated granulosa cells (45) and, therefore, may be a critical event in increasing both basal activity of 2M as well as increasing the expression of PRLR.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	298	 In combination, these two events promote enhanced transcription of 2M by PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	299	 As mentioned above, most cells do not express SF-1 but do express COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	300	 Therefore, it is possible that in these cells the repressor activity of COUP-TF is unopposed by any other transcription factor, thereby reducing expression of the gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	301	In summary, we have shown that expression of the 2M gene in ovarian granulosa-luteal cells involves not only PRL-induced activation of Stat 5b/a but also the opposing interactions of SF-1 and COUP-TF on an ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	302	 The close juxtaposition of these regions initially indicated that there might be a functional synergism between the factors binding to the PRLRE and the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	303	 However, using site-specific mutations, rather that deletion analyses, we have been able to show that these regions act independently of each other in the context of the intact 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	304	Animals Intact immature Sprague Dawley (23 days old) female rats were obtained from Harlan (Indianapolis, IN) and maintained under a 16-h light, 8-h dark schedule, with food and water ad libitum.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	305	 Animals were treated in accordance with the NIH Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	306	 All protocols were approved by the Institutional Committee on Animal Care and Use, Baylor College Of Medicine (Houston, TX).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	307	 Rats were delivered on day 23 of age and weighed 50 to 55 g.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	308	 Rats were injected sc on days 24 to 26 with 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	309	Granulosa Cell Culture Ovaries isolated from immature rats primed with 17ss-estradiol were punctured with a 22-gauge needle to isolate granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	310	 The granulosa cells were pooled and treated with trypsin (20  microg/ml) for 1 min, followed by the addition of soybean trypsin inhibitor (300  microg/ml) and DNAse (100  microg/ml) to remove necrotic cells (47).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	311	 After washing the cells twice, they were cultured for 48 h in DMEM-Ham s F12 (DMEM:F12; 1:1) supplemented with a low dose of oFSH (50 ng/ml) and T (10 ng/ml) at 37 C in 95% air and 5% CO2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	312	 Granulosa cells were cultured for 24 h in the absence of FSH and T or for 48 h in the presence of FSH and T (47, 48).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	313	 At each time period, cells were treated with PRL (1  microg/ml) or forskolin (10  microM).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	314	 At indicated time points, total RNA was isolated for Northern analyses, WCEs were prepared for EMSAs, and immunoblots or the cells were used for transient transfections of various expression vectors.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	315	RNA Isolation and Northern Analysis Extraction buffer containing 1% Nonidet P-40 was used for isolation of cytoplasmic RNA from granulosa cells (49).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	316	 RNA samples were extracted with phenol-chloroform, ethanol precipitated, resuspended in water containing 0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	317	1% dimethyl pyrocarbonate, and quantitated by measuring the absorbance at 260 nm.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	318	 For Northern blot analyses, 20  microg RNA were denatured at 55 C for 15 min in 45% formamide-5.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	319	4% formaldehyde and resolved by electrophoresis at room temperature in a formaldehyde-agarose gel.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	320	 To confirm equal loading of RNA samples and to determine the migration of the standards in the RNA ladder, the gel was stained with acridine orange.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	321	 After transfer of the RNA to nylon membranes, the blots were baked, prehybridized, and hybridized with P32-labeled 2M cDNA probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	322	 Blots were washed four times, 5 min/wash at room temperature in 2x saline sodium citrate, 0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	323	1% SDS, followed by two washes, 15 min each, in 0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	324	1% SDS at 55 C and exposed to film at -80 C.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	325	Immunoprecipitations and Immunoblot Analyses Protein A on tryacryl beads (30  microl) was incubated with 200  microg WCEs for 1 h at 4 C with shaking.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	326	 After a brief spin, the supernatant was incubated with 1  microl Stat 5b antibody and 20  microl diluted beads for 24 h at 4 C with shaking.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	327	 Each of the samples was then washed three times with WCE buffer to remove unbound protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	328	 Bound proteins were eluted from the beads by addition of an equal volume of SDS-loading buffer and boiled at 100 C for 10 min.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	329	 Samples were resolved by 10% one-dimensional SDS-PAGE at 20 mA for 6 to 7 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	330	 Electrophoretic transfer to Immobilon polyvinylidene difluoride (PVDF) membrane was performed at 12 V overnight at 4 C.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	331	 After blocking with 5% milk for 2 h, filters were incubated with PY20 antiphosphotyrosine antibody (1:250).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	332	 The filters were then washed with Tris-buffered saline, 0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	333	05% Tween (20 mM Tris, 150 mM NaCl, pH 7.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	334	 The blots were incubated with 1:10,000 of antirabbit-horseradish peroxidase or antimouse-horseradish peroxidase.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	335	 Filters were then washed six times for 5 min each with TBST.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	336	 ECL reagents were used to detect specific proteins as described by Amersham.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	337	 The same blot was stripped (2% SDS, 50 mM ss-mercaptoethanol, 50 mM Tris, pH 6.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	338	 After extensive washes with TBST, the blot was reprobed with anti-Stat 5b antibody (1:10,000).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	339	Plasmid Constructs The luciferase constructs pSVoA1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	340	2 kb2M (from -1152 to +54 bp) and the Stat mutants have been described previously (16).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	341	 All the luciferase constructs in Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	342	 1 were generated by initially isolating the 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	343	2-kb HindIII fragment from pSVoA1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	344	2 kb2M and ligating it to pGL3 basic luciferase vector from Promega to obtain 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	345	 -3712M was generated by ligating the 425-bp fragment (StuI:HindIII digest of the 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	346	2-kb fragment) to pGL3 Basic SmaI:HindIII site.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	347	 -209 2M was generated by ligating the 298-bp fragment (RsaI:HindIII digest of the 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	348	2-kb fragment) to pGL3 Basic SmaI:HindIII site.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	349	 -1592M was generated by digesting -3712M with EcoRI and SacI, which deletes the PRLRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	350	 -209 2M was digested with EcoRI:PvuII to generate -2092M in which the ORRE is deleted.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	351	 -482M, the minimal 2M promoter, was created by a PvuII digest of -3712M.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	352	 4XGAS2M, containing four copies of the proximal Stat-binding site, has been described previously (16, 24).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	353	 Stat 5b and a splice variant of Stat 5b (Stat 5b-40C) were cloned to the expression vector pSVsport GIBCO BRL (Grandland, NY) and have been described previously (32).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	354	The mutations (indicated in lower case) within the ORRE (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	355	 5a) of the 2M promoter were created by PCR using the -317 2M as a template.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	356	 The primers used include mutant antisense oligonucleotides to either the COUP-TF (M1) site or the SF-1 site (M2) and the external sense and antisense primers that would hybridize at each end of the promoter region.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	357	 The double mutant was generated with the same external primers, mutant oligonucleotide, and the COUP-TF mutant construct as the template.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	358	 The sequence of the oligonucleotides is as follows:.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	359	mCOUP-TF: 5'-ATtGttTAATTAttGCCAAGGTTAATTCCT-aAttCGTTAGtCAG-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	360	mSF-1: 5'-ATGGCCTAATTACCGCCAAttTTAATTCCTGA-CCCGTTAGTCCAG-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	361	double mutant: 5'-ATTGCCAAttTTAATTCCTAA-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	362	sense: 5'-CGGGGTACCCCGCCTCCTTGCCAACTATT-CC-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	363	antisense: 5'-GTGCAAACAGCTGCTCCCACCC-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	364	Figure 11 is a schematic representation of the PCR-directed mutagenesis.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	365	 The cloning procedure was as described in PCR protocols (50).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	366	 The PCR products were separated and purified by 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	367	5% low-melt agarose gel using an overnight ss-agarase digestion (50).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	368	 After the second round of PCR, the purified products were isolated, digested with KpnI and PvuII, and ligated using sites present in the multiple cloning cassette of -371 2M construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	369	 All plasmids were sequenced in both directions by Sanger s dideoxy method (50).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	370	View larger version (8K):    Figure 11.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	371	  Transient Transfection Assay Plasmid DNA was purified from bacteria by alkaline lysis and centrifugation on CsCl gradients (51).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	372	 Differentiated granulosa cells in culture were transfected with different plasmid constructs using a calcium phosphate precipitation technique (52).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	373	 After 30 min incubation at room temperature, 300  microl of the precipitate were added to the cultures (3 ml) and incubated for 4 h at 37 C.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	374	 Each construct was transfected in triplicate for each treatment.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	375	 SV40 luciferase construct containing the SV40 promoter enhancer elements was used as a positive control in each of the transfection experiments.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	376	 Cells were then washed twice with Ca++- and Mg++-free HBSS before feeding with fresh DMEM/F12 media containing FSH (50 ng/ml) and T (10 ng/ml) with or without PRL (1  microg/ml) or forskolin (10  microM) for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	377	 Cells were then washed with 1x PBS and lysed with lysis buffer (0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	378	 The soluble protein obtained after centrifugation was assayed for luciferase activity using a Monolight 2010 Luminometer (Analytical Luminesence Laboratories, San Diego, CA).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	379	 The luciferase activity in 20  microl of each sample was normalized to the amount of protein, as measured by the Bradford assay (Bio-Rad), and expressed as relative light units/ microg protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	380	Oligonucleotides and Nomenclature The functionally active PRLRE of the 2M promoter contains two Stat- binding sites, AACTGGAAA and TTCTGGGAA (GAS) sequences, as described previously (24, 10).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	381	 The sequence of 2MGAS2 oligonucleotide used in EMSA is 5'-GATCATCCTTCTGGGAATTCTGATATCCTTCTGGGAATTC-TG3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	382	 The ORRE sequence shown in Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	383	 5A was used to generate mutant oligonucleotides:.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	384	M1: 5'-CTGaCTAACGaaTtAGGAATTAACCTTGGCAATAA-TTAaaCaAT-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	385	M2: 5'-ATGGCCTAATTACCGCCAAttTTAATTCCTGACCC-GTTAGCCAG-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	386	Sequences of other oligonucleotides used in EMSAs are as follows:.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	387	DR1SF-1: 5'-CTGGCTAACGGGTCAGGAATTAACCTTGG-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	388	DR2SF-1: 5'-GGAATTAACCTTGGCGGTAATTAGGCCAT-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	389	Consensus COUP-TF: 5'-TGTCTTAGAGGTCAAAGGTCAAAT-3' (28).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	390	Hexameric SF-1: 5'-GAGTCTCCCAAGGTCATCCTTGT-TT-3' (6).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	391	Oligonucleotides were synthesized, purified, and provided by Genosys, Inc.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	392	Whole Cell Extracts and EMSA Granulosa cells were cultured with FSH and T for 24 h or 48 h and then treated with or without PRL (1  microg/ml) for 15 min, 6 h, and 20 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	393	 The cells were harvested by scraping and lysed by three cycles of freeze thawing to prepare soluble extracts (53).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	394	 Protein samples were measured (Bradford; Bio-Rad).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	395	 All samples were stored at -70 C until EMSA and immunoblot analyses were done.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	396	 EMSAs were performed as described previously (54).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	397	 Briefly, WCE (10 to 15  microg per lane) were incubated for 30 min at room temperature with 50,000 to 60,000 cpm of end-labeled double-stranded oligonucleotide with or without the competitor DNA and 5  microg poly(deoxyinosinic-deoxycytidylic)acid in a final volume of 20  microl in a buffer containing 100 mM KCl, 15 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	398	5), 5 mM dithiothreitol, 1 mM EDTA, 5 mM MgCl2, and 12% glycerol.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	399	 When antibodies were used, WCEs were incubated with 1  microl of the antiserum for 30 min on ice before addition of the labeled probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	400	 Binding reactions were resolved by 5% acrylamide, 0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	401	 Gels were dried under vacuum and heat and exposed to Kodak XAR film at -80 C.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	402	RT-PCR For each RT reaction, 350 ng RNA were reverse transcribed as previously described (55, 56).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	403	 PCR was performed as previously described (55).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	404	 The sequence of primers used for the PRLRs is as follows:.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	405	Forward primer: 5'-ATACTGGAGTAGATGGAGCCAGGAGAGTTC-3' and specific.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	406	Reverse LPRLR: 5'-CTTCCGTGACCAGAGTCACTGTCG-GGATCT-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	407	Reverse SPRLR: 5'-TCCTATTTGAGTCTGCAGCTTCAGTAGTCA-3'.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	408	Primers for L19 were used as an internal control.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	409	 PCR was performed for 20 cycles (Perkin-Elmer/Cetus, Norwalk, CT) with a denaturing temperature of 92 C (1 min), an annealing temperature of 60 C (2 min), and an extension temperature of 72 C (3 min).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	410	 Reaction (20  microl) was electrophoresed on a 5% polyacrylamide gel in 0.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	411	 The gels were dried and the bands quantified with Storm860 PhosphoImager (Molecular Dynamics, Sunnyvale, CA).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	412	 Specific PCR products amplified for the LPRLR-422 bp and the SPRLR-332 bp were normalized to the L19 band from the same sample.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	413	 Gels were also exposed to HyperFilm (Amersham) for 6 to 24 h at room temperature.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	414	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   The authors wish to thank Dr.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	415	 Ming-Jer Tsai, Department of Cell Biology, Baylor College of Medicine, for their helpful suggestions and reagents that were provided during the course of these experiments.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	416	 Lothar Henninghausen, Laboratory of Biochemistry and Metabolism, National Institute of Diabetes, Digestive and Kidney Diseases, NIH (Bethesda, MD) for the antibodies to Stat 5b, and Dr.
